cards.title: Accidents
cards.question: I wonder how many accidents I’ve had in my life. I’ve had a few serious ones where I’ve ended up in hospital. Traffic accidents are the worst. They’re always painful. I haven’t had too many work-related accidents. I suppose that’s because I do office work and that’s not so dangerous. Most of my accidents are those around the house. I’ve lost count of the number of times I’ve hit my thumb with a hammer. I’m also really good at standing up and hitting my head on something. I’m not as bad as my friend though. He’s a real accident looking for somewhere to happen. Almost every time we meet, he has some story to tell about his latest accident. He’s quite unbelievable. I think I’d be very worried if I were his mother.
cards.answer: 我不知道這輩子經歷過多少次意外。我曾經出過幾次嚴重的意外，最後都進了醫院。交通事故是最糟糕的，總是很痛苦。我沒有遇到太多工作相關的意外。我想那是因為我做的是辦公室工作，沒那麼危險。我大部分的意外都是在家裡發生的。我已經數不清有多少次用錘子敲到自己的拇指了。我也很擅長站起來時撞到頭。不過我沒有我朋友那麼糟。他簡直就是一個四處尋找意外的人。幾乎每次我們見面，他都有關於最新意外的故事要講。他真的很不可思議。如果我是他媽媽，我想我會非常擔心。

cards.title: Actors
cards.question: Being an actor must be great. I really wish I could act. I’d love to have the confidence to act in front of people. Being a member of the audience at the theatre is great, but acting on stage is better. I wonder what it’s like to be a movie star. I think you need to be beautiful or handsome to be a successful Hollywood or Bollywood actor. They all look great. Actors are very lucky. They get paid huge amounts of money to do what they love doing. My favourite actors are all dead now. I really like the actors in the old black and white movies. They all looked so cool. Actors in the old days seemed to be more glamorous than today’s actors. The best thing about being an actor is that all of your friends are famous too.
cards.answer: 當演員一定很棒。我真希望我會演戲。我很想擁有在人們面前表演的自信。在劇院當觀眾已經很棒了，但在舞台上表演更好。我很好奇當電影明星是什麼感覺。我認為要成為成功的好萊塢或寶萊塢演員，你需要長得漂亮或英俊。他們看起來都很棒。演員們非常幸運。他們做自己喜歡的事情就能賺到大筆的錢。我最喜歡的演員現在都已經過世了。我真的很喜歡老黑白電影裡的演員。他們看起來都很酷。以前的演員似乎比現在的演員更有魅力。當演員最棒的事情是你所有的朋友也都很有名。

cards.title: Advertising
cards.question: What is advertising? Is it telling the truth or is it making things look better than they really are? Or is it lying? Companies pay a lot of money for adverts. Some of the ads you see in glossy magazines look like art. The commercials on TV look like mini movies. Do they really change our behaviour? Do adverts make you buy things? I think some advertising is a form of lying. Is BMW really “The ultimate driving machine” like they say in their ads? British Airways used to say they were “The world’s favourite airline,” but had to stop saying it because it wasn’t true. Personally, I get tired of watching ads on television. They always interrupt a good programme. I like ads in magazines. They’re usually quite interesting.
cards.answer: 什麼是廣告？它是在說真話，還是在把事情描繪得比實際上更好？或者它是在說謊？公司為廣告付出大量的金錢。你在光面雜誌上看到的一些廣告看起來像藝術品。電視上的商業廣告看起來像迷你電影。它們真的會改變我們的行為嗎？廣告會讓你買東西嗎？我認為有些廣告是一種謊言。BMW真的像他們廣告說的那樣是「終極駕駛機器」嗎？英國航空公司曾經說他們是「世界上最受歡迎的航空公司」，但因為這不是真的，他們不得不停止這樣說。就我個人而言，我厭倦了看電視廣告。它們總是打斷好節目。我喜歡雜誌裡的廣告，通常都挺有趣的。

cards.title: Advice
cards.question: I don’t know what I would do without my friends’ advice. They’ve all given me so much good advice over the years. It’s sometimes very difficult to make decisions on your own. Listening to advice can be great for helping you make the right decision. The greatest piece of advice I’ve received was from my father. He told me I can do anything in life if I try hard. He was right. I am now passing on his advice to my own children. Right now I need some advice on money. My financial advisors are telling me to be very careful. That’s very sound advice. I would advise anyone to do the same. Someone asked me the other day about the worst piece of advice I’ve ever had. I couldn’t answer. I don’t think I’ve had any really bad advice.
cards.answer: 沒有朋友的建議，我不知道該怎麼辦。這些年來他們給了我很多好建議。有時候很難獨自做決定。聆聽建議對幫助你做出正確決定非常有用。我收到過最好的建議是來自我父親。他告訴我，只要努力嘗試，生活中什麼都可以做到。他是對的。我現在正在把他的建議傳給我自己的孩子。現在我需要一些關於金錢的建議。我的財務顧問告訴我要非常小心。這是非常明智的建議。我會建議任何人都這樣做。前幾天有人問我收到過最糟糕的建議是什麼。我回答不出來。我不認為我收到過任何真正糟糕的建議。

cards.title: Airplanes
cards.question: Airplanes are amazing. How does something so big and heavy get off the ground? I’m always amazed at how the millions of different parts work together. Travelling by airplane is always a wonderful experience. I don’t care whether economy class is cramped and has no space. I like playing with the in-flight entertainment system, especially now they have all the latest movies. I also love airplane food. Many of my friends say it’s disgusting, but I love it. I often ask the passenger next to me if I can have the dessert or roll they don’t want. The only thing I don’t like about planes is turbulence. When the airplane hits those air pockets, I always worry we’ll crash. But I once read that turbulence has never caused an airplane to crash.
cards.answer: 飛機真是太神奇了。這麼大又這麼重的東西是怎麼離開地面的？數百萬個不同的零件如何協同工作，總是讓我驚嘆不已。搭飛機旅行總是一種美妙的體驗。我不在乎經濟艙是否擁擠、沒有空間。我喜歡玩機上娛樂系統，特別是現在他們有所有最新的電影。我也喜歡飛機餐。我很多朋友說它很難吃，但我很喜歡。我經常問旁邊的乘客能不能把他們不要的甜點或麵包給我。我唯一不喜歡飛機的地方是亂流。當飛機遇到氣流時，我總是擔心會墜機。但我曾經讀到亂流從未導致過飛機墜毀。

cards.title: Airports
cards.question: Aren’t airports strange places? There’s so much happening in them. People coming, people going; people crying with sadness because they’re going away, people crying with joy because they’ve arrived. Big airports are almost like small towns. It seems like you walk across a town by the time you check in and get to your departure gate. The thing I like most about airports is people watching. There are people from all over the world. I also like how everything fits and works together. You check your luggage in and then it disappears, before you see it again at the next airport. I still think airports need improving. There’s not a lot to do there. Airports really need to have an entertainment area so people can kill time.
cards.answer: 機場不是很奇怪的地方嗎？裡面發生著這麼多事情。有人來，有人走；有人因為要離開而傷心哭泣，有人因為到達而喜極而泣。大型機場幾乎就像小城鎮。從辦理登機手續到到達登機門，感覺就像穿越了一個城鎮。我最喜歡機場的事情是觀察人群。那裡有來自世界各地的人。我也喜歡一切如何配合和運作。你托運行李，然後它消失了，直到你在下一個機場再次看到它。我仍然認為機場需要改進。那裡沒有太多事情可做。機場真的需要有一個娛樂區，讓人們可以打發時間。

cards.title: Alcohol
cards.question: I hate alcohol. I really don’t understand how or why people drink it. The smell of alcohol on people’s breath is disgusting. It’s expensive and it gives you a bad headache. I drank when I was much younger, but I haven’t touched a drop for years. I hated hangovers so I decided to stop drinking altogether. I have a much better time without alcohol. people say they need to drink to relax. They drink and just act and look stupid. Their face goes red and they can’t walk in a straight line. Alcohol is also the most damaging drug in society. That’s what I think, anyway. Alcohol causes many illnesses, traffic accidents, fights and domestic violence. If you banned alcohol, people would be healthier, richer and have a better family life.
cards.answer: 我討厭酒精。我真的不理解人們怎麼會喝酒，或為什麼要喝酒。人們呼吸中的酒精味令人噁心。它很貴，還會讓你頭痛。我年輕時喝過酒，但已經好幾年滴酒未沾了。我討厭宿醉，所以決定完全戒酒。沒有酒精我過得更開心。人們說他們需要喝酒來放鬆。他們喝了酒後行為舉止看起來都很蠢。他們的臉變紅，走路都走不直。酒精也是社會中最具破壞性的毒品。反正這是我的看法。酒精會導致許多疾病、交通事故、打架和家庭暴力。如果你禁止酒精，人們會更健康、更富有，家庭生活也會更好。

cards.title: Aliens
cards.question: There are aliens out there, somewhere. I strongly believe this. Not sure what they look like, though. I really doubt they are green, like they are in science fiction movies. I also don’t think they look like us. But I’m sure they exist. I just don’t think we’ll ever see any or find any. They live too far away. If you think about it logically, there has to be aliens out there. All a planet needs is to be warm and have water and life will exist. There are billions and billions of planets in the universe, so there are probably millions and millions that have life. Alien life. It’s also likely that some of the aliens are much more intelligent than we are. I wonder what we’d do if really intelligent aliens visited Earth. What would we ask them?
cards.answer: 外星人是存在的，在某個地方。我堅信這一點。不過不確定他們長什麼樣子。我真的懷疑他們像科幻電影裡那樣是綠色的。我也不認為他們長得像我們。但我確信他們存在。我只是不認為我們會看到或找到他們。他們住得太遠了。如果你理性地想一想，外星人肯定存在。一個星球只需要溫暖和水就會有生命存在。宇宙中有數十億個行星，所以可能有數百萬個有生命的行星。外星生命。也很可能有些外星人比我們聰明得多。我很想知道如果真的有聰明的外星人造訪地球，我們會怎麼做。我們會問他們什麼？

cards.title: Animals
cards.question: I’m a real animal lover. I’m fascinated by the whole animal kingdom. I loved animals when I was a kid. I used to read every book I could find on animals. I knew all the different animal species. The most exciting thing for me was going to the zoo. I would spend hours just watching the animals walk around, sit, or even sleep. When I was older, I went on a safari to Tanzania. I saw real wild animals in the wild. Everyone should do this once in their lives. Looking at animals in their natural habitat is a real honour. Now I’m worried about the future of many animals. Some of my favourite animals are in danger of dying out. We really need to change our lifestyle so our children can have the chance of seeing animals in the wild.
cards.answer: 我是一個真正的動物愛好者。整個動物王國都讓我著迷。我小時候就愛動物。我會閱讀所有能找到的關於動物的書。我知道所有不同的動物物種。對我來說最興奮的事情是去動物園。我會花幾個小時看著動物走來走去、坐著，甚至睡覺。長大後，我去了坦尚尼亞的野生動物園。我在野外看到了真正的野生動物。每個人一生中都應該這樣做一次。在自然棲息地觀看動物是一種真正的榮幸。現在我擔心許多動物的未來。一些我最喜歡的動物正面臨滅絕的危險。我們真的需要改變我們的生活方式，讓我們的孩子有機會在野外看到動物。

cards.title: Anti Aging Creams
cards.question: The other day I saw an advert on the Internet asking for volunteers to test a new skin cream. It was an anti-aging product. How is it possible for a cream or lotion to stop us looking old? I don't think any skincare goods can make us look younger. I certainly don't believe cosmetics companies that say their expensive creams can remove wrinkles. They just want to make lots of money. Why do people believe them? How do they know their creams work? They did not test their products on thousands of people over 50 years. I think if a person uses an anti-aging cream for 50 years, they would not even look a year younger when they are 60. This means it's a huge waste of money. Only healthy living can keep us looking younger.
cards.answer: 前幾天我在網路上看到一則廣告，徵求志願者測試一款新的護膚霜。那是一款抗老產品。乳霜或乳液怎麼可能阻止我們看起來變老呢？我不認為任何護膚品能讓我們看起來更年輕。我當然不相信化妝品公司說他們昂貴的乳霜可以去除皺紋。他們只是想賺很多錢。為什麼人們會相信他們？他們怎麼知道他們的乳霜有效？他們並沒有在數千人身上測試產品五十年。我認為如果一個人使用抗老霜五十年，到六十歲時他們甚至不會看起來年輕一歲。這意味著這是巨大的金錢浪費。只有健康的生活方式才能讓我們看起來更年輕。

cards.title: Apartments
cards.question: In the USA, they’re called apartments; in the UK they’re called flats. They are a modern invention. I don’t particularly like them. I don’t think it’s good for so many people to live so close together. It’s not good for people to live on top of each other. I don’t understand how people can live above the second floor. It’s not natural to live in the sky. The thing I hate most about apartments are the lifts (Americans say elevator) and the fact there’s no garden. More and more people are moving into apartments. This creates problems with overcrowding. There aren’t enough spaces to park your car, there’s nowhere to throw your rubbish and you have to wait ages to reach your floor. Give me a little house with a little garden any day.
cards.answer: 在美國，它們被稱為公寓（apartments）；在英國它們被稱為公寓（flats）。它們是現代的發明。我並不特別喜歡它們。我認為這麼多人住在一起不太好。人們住在彼此頭上不是件好事。我不明白人們怎麼能住在二樓以上。住在天空中是不自然的。我最討厭公寓的是電梯（英國人說lift，美國人說elevator）和沒有花園這個事實。越來越多的人搬進公寓。這造成了過度擁擠的問題。沒有足夠的停車位，沒有地方扔垃圾，而且你必須等很久才能到達你的樓層。隨時給我一棟帶小花園的小房子吧。

cards.title: Art
cards.question: I’m a great art lover. I look at beautiful paintings and sculptures and wish I could be artistic. I can’t draw or paint to save my life. I wonder why some people are so talented and can create amazing pictures, when other people, like me, can’t even draw good matchstick figures. I would like to fill my house with art from all over the world. It’s interesting to see how different cultures have different kinds of art. There’s nothing better than visiting art galleries when you go to another country. I prefer more traditional art. I don’t really understand a lot of modern art. I look at an exhibit of a pile of bricks in a museum but can’t see how it’s art. I always laugh when my children say, “Daddy, I can do better than that!” I often think they can.
cards.answer: 我是一個偉大的藝術愛好者。我看著美麗的繪畫和雕塑，希望自己也能有藝術天分。我的繪畫和畫畫能力糟透了。我很好奇為什麼有些人這麼有才華，能創造出驚人的圖畫，而其他人，像我，連火柴人都畫不好。我想用來自世界各地的藝術品填滿我的房子。看到不同文化有不同類型的藝術很有趣。去另一個國家時，沒有什麼比參觀美術館更好的了。我比較喜歡傳統藝術。我真的不太理解很多現代藝術。我在博物館裡看到一堆磚塊的展品，但看不出它是怎麼算藝術的。當我的孩子們說「爸爸，我可以做得比那更好！」時，我總是笑。我經常認為他們確實可以。

cards.title: Autumn
cards.question: Autumn is such a cool time of the year. Of course it is cool because the temperatures drop after summer. But it is also cool because it’s such a great time of the year. I love the changing of the leaves. The different autumn colours are one of nature’s most beautiful scenes. Sometimes I can’t stop looking at the mountains near my house. They are like an artist’s palette of golds, reds, yellows, browns and other autumnal colours. In America they call autumn ‘fall’ because that is when the leaves fall from the trees. I like the coolness of autumn. Summer is over but you can still wear a T-shirt – just about. You can also spend hours outdoors without sweating. Autumn is the best time of the year to go hiking and go for long walks.
cards.answer: 秋天是一年中如此美好的季節。當然它很涼爽，因為夏天之後溫度下降了。但它也很美好，因為這是一年中這麼棒的時光。我喜歡葉子的變化。不同的秋天顏色是大自然最美麗的景象之一。有時候我無法停止看著我家附近的山。它們就像藝術家的調色盤，有金色、紅色、黃色、棕色和其他秋天的顏色。在美國他們把秋天叫做「fall」，因為那是樹葉從樹上落下的時候。我喜歡秋天的涼爽。夏天結束了，但你仍然可以穿T恤——勉強可以。你也可以在戶外待幾個小時而不會流汗。秋天是一年中去徒步旅行和長途散步的最佳時間。

cards.title: Avatars
cards.question: Most people know the word 'avatar'. Perhaps we all saw the movie with the same name. Avatars are becoming a normal part of our life. Well... I should say our online life. Almost everywhere you go on the Internet you see avatars. Sometimes it's a website asking you to make an avatar, and other times it's people's real avatars. Do you have one? Or two, or three? I see a lot of avatars that are kind of cute and look like Japanese anime. One of the most popular things is to choose an animal as an avatar. I always take a long time to choose my avatar. It's important to make one I really like. It has to be funny. I also like avatars that move. All of the best avatars I've seen move. They are usually very funny, and clever.
cards.answer: 大多數人都知道「avatar」這個詞。也許我們都看過同名電影。虛擬替身正在成為我們生活的正常部分。嗯……我應該說是我們的網路生活。你在網路上幾乎到處都能看到虛擬替身。有時是一個網站要求你製作一個虛擬替身，有時是人們真正的虛擬替身。你有嗎？或者兩個、三個？我看到很多虛擬替身都很可愛，看起來像日本動漫。最受歡迎的事情之一是選擇動物作為虛擬替身。我總是花很長時間選擇我的虛擬替身。製作一個我真正喜歡的很重要。它必須要有趣。我也喜歡會動的虛擬替身。我見過的最好的虛擬替身都會動。它們通常非常有趣，而且很聰明。

cards.title: Babysitting
cards.question: I loved babysitting when I was younger. It was a really easy way to make money. All I had to do was sit in my neighbour’s house and look after the kids. That was the easy bit, because the kids were usually asleep in bed. The parents would give me a lot of money for watching DVDs and eating snacks. When I was even younger, I liked it when my babysitter came round. She would always play games with us and let us stay up late. She would send us to bed just before my parents came home. I know in some countries, babysitting isn’t so common. It isn’t part of the culture. I suppose that’s not such a bad thing. I read a lot in the papers nowadays about babysitters hitting the children because they don’t sleep. That’s really bad.
cards.answer: 我年輕時很喜歡當保姆。這是一種非常輕鬆的賺錢方式。我只需要坐在鄰居家照顧孩子。這是容易的部分，因為孩子們通常已經在床上睡著了。父母會給我很多錢，讓我看DVD和吃零食。我更小的時候，我喜歡保姆來我們家。她總是和我們玩遊戲，讓我們晚睡。她會在我父母回來之前讓我們上床睡覺。我知道在一些國家，當保姆不是那麼常見。這不是文化的一部分。我想這不是什麼壞事。我現在經常在報紙上讀到保姆因為孩子不睡覺而打他們。那真的很糟糕。

cards.title: Bad Habits
cards.question: What are your bad habits? I think everyone has bad habits. Not everyone agrees on what bad habits are. Some smokers don’t think smoking is a bad habit. Young people don’t think listening to loud music on the train is a bad habit. In Japan, slurping your noodles is a sign that you enjoy your food, but making a noise while eating in England is not good. Have you ever tried to break your bad habits? I have quit smoking and have stopped leaving things laying around the house. I wish other people would stop their bad habits. I get annoyed when people are late for meetings or talk loudly on their phones in public. I also think many motorists need to think about their driving habits. Perhaps I should point out their bad habits.
cards.answer: 你有什麼壞習慣？我認為每個人都有壞習慣。並不是每個人都同意什麼是壞習慣。有些吸煙者不認為吸煙是壞習慣。年輕人不認為在火車上聽大聲音樂是壞習慣。在日本，吃麵條時發出聲音是表示你享受食物的標誌，但在英國吃東西時發出聲音不太好。你有沒有試過改掉你的壞習慣？我已經戒了煙，也不再把東西亂放在房子裡。我希望其他人也能改掉他們的壞習慣。當人們開會遲到或在公共場合大聲講電話時，我會很惱火。我也認為許多駕駛者需要考慮一下他們的駕駛習慣。也許我應該指出他們的壞習慣。

cards.title: Banks
cards.question: I’m not the world’s biggest fan of banks. I’ve had too many bad experiences of them. I really don’t know how they can advertise and say they look after you. They don’t. Bank charges are way too high; you spend ages waiting to be served; and then they say no if you want a loan. The bank I bank with makes dozens of mistakes with my account. The thing they’re best at is making excuses. I’m not at all surprised so many banks did badly in the credit crisis. I hope they change. Bankers get far too much money. All they do is desk work. Banks need to focus a lot more on real customer service. At the moment banks only offer an excuse for customer service. They don’t even offer you a drink when you sit down and open an account.
cards.answer: 我不是銀行的最大粉絲。我有過太多不好的經歷。我真的不知道他們怎麼能做廣告說他們會照顧你。他們不會。銀行收費太高了；你要等很久才能得到服務；然後如果你想貸款，他們就說不。我開戶的銀行對我的帳戶犯了很多錯誤。他們最擅長的是找藉口。我一點也不驚訝這麼多銀行在信貸危機中表現不好。我希望他們能改變。銀行家賺太多錢了。他們只是做辦公桌工作。銀行需要更加注重真正的客戶服務。目前銀行只提供客戶服務的藉口。當你坐下來開戶時，他們甚至不給你一杯飲料。

cards.title: Baths
cards.question: One of my favourite times of the day is bath time. I absolutely love taking a bath. Baths are so much better than showers. Having a bath is the most relaxing thing. There’s nothing better in life than sinking into a hot bath and letting the water take away my troubles. A bath really makes you feel great. I especially like taking a bath before going to bed. Bath time is pretty much the only time of the day when you can really pamper yourself. It also means a lot of quality time to yourself. It’s perfect for listening to music and reading a good book. The only thing I don’t like about bath time is when I fall asleep and the water goes cold. Or even worse – when you want a bath and there’s no hot water.
cards.answer: 一天中我最喜歡的時間之一是洗澡時間。我絕對喜歡泡澡。泡澡比淋浴好多了。泡澡是最放鬆的事情。生活中沒有什麼比沉入熱水澡中，讓水帶走我的煩惱更好的了。泡澡真的讓你感覺很棒。我特別喜歡睡前泡澡。洗澡時間幾乎是一天中唯一可以真正寵愛自己的時間。這也意味著很多獨處的優質時間。這是聽音樂和讀一本好書的完美時光。我唯一不喜歡洗澡時間的是當我睡著了，水變冷的時候。或者更糟的是——當你想洗澡卻沒有熱水的時候。

cards.title: Beauty
cards.question: People say that beauty is in the eye of the beholder. That means if someone thinks someone else is beautiful, then they are beautiful. I think the idea of beauty is interesting. Why do we think some things or some people are beautiful and others aren’t? Some people think a building is beautiful, while others think the opposite. People nowadays spend too much time and money on beauty. I agree with the expression, “beauty is only skin deep”. This means that what’s really important is someone’s heart and character, not what they look like on the outside. It’s a little strange, and unfair, that you have to be beautiful to be a top actress or even a news reader on TV. I think there should be equal rights for most of us “non-beautiful” people.
cards.answer: 人們說美在觀者的眼中。這意味著如果有人認為另一個人很美，那麼他們就是美麗的。我認為美的概念很有趣。為什麼我們認為有些東西或有些人很美，而其他的不是？有些人認為一棟建築很美，而其他人認為相反。現在人們在美麗上花費太多時間和金錢了。我同意「美只是膚淺的」這個說法。這意味著真正重要的是一個人的心靈和性格，而不是他們外表看起來怎樣。有點奇怪和不公平的是，你必須長得漂亮才能成為頂級女演員，甚至是電視新聞主播。我認為我們大多數「不漂亮」的人應該有平等的權利。

cards.title: Being Afraid
cards.question: An American president once said the only thing you have to fear is fear itself. Can’t remember which President, but never mind. I think that’s an interesting quote. It’s so true, most of the time. We all spend a lot of time worried or afraid that something bad will happen, and then nothing happens. It is the fear that frightens us, not the thing that might or might not happen. And then there are phobias. Millions of people are afraid of something that the rest of the world thinks is quite normal. How can you be afraid of things like peanut butter? There’s actually a fear of peanut butter sticking to the roof of your mouth. Amazing. Fear is sometimes good. It makes us alert and can keep us safe in a dangerous situation.
cards.answer: 一位美國總統曾經說過，你唯一需要害怕的就是恐懼本身。不記得是哪位總統了，但沒關係。我認為這是一句有趣的話。大多數時候它是如此真實。我們都花很多時間擔心或害怕會發生不好的事情，然後什麼都沒發生。是恐懼嚇到了我們，而不是可能發生或可能不會發生的事情。還有恐懼症。數百萬人害怕世界上其他人認為很正常的東西。你怎麼能害怕像花生醬這樣的東西？真的有一種恐懼是害怕花生醬粘在嘴巴頂部。太神奇了。恐懼有時是好的。它使我們保持警覺，在危險的情況下可以保護我們的安全。

cards.title: Being Married
cards.question: Getting married is one of the happiest days of anyone’s life. Being married is also full of happiness, but there are also many difficulties. It isn’t always easy to be married. You have to put up with your spouse’s bad habits and moods forever. You have to negotiate and compromise on many things from who’s first in the bathroom in the mornings to where you go on vacation. Of course, being married also has many wonderful sides to it. You have a lifelong friend who will love you forever. You share many wonderful times together and support each other through good and bad times. And you grow old together and look back on years of happy memories. I think being married is great for your soul.
cards.answer: 結婚是任何人一生中最幸福的日子之一。婚姻生活也充滿了幸福，但也有很多困難。結婚並不總是容易的。你必須永遠忍受配偶的壞習慣和情緒。你必須在很多事情上協商和妥協，從早上誰先用浴室到你們去哪裡度假。當然，婚姻也有很多美好的一面。你有一個會永遠愛你的終身朋友。你們一起分享很多美好的時光，在好時光和壞時光中互相支持。你們一起變老，回顧多年的幸福回憶。我認為婚姻對你的靈魂很好。

cards.title: Being Single
cards.question: Being single has its advantages and disadvantages. I think it’s better to stay single when you’re young. You need to live and have fun. You also need the freedom to do what you want, when you want. Being single in your twenties gives you lots of time to go travelling, see the world and experience different things. Most people like being single in their twenties and then want to settle down in their thirties. I think being single later in life can be sad. All of your friends are married or attached and people tend to go out and party less. I think being single when you’re old would be very lonely. The longer you stay single, the harder it becomes to settle down. In some countries, people think you’re strange if you’re single later on in life.
cards.answer: 單身有優點也有缺點。我認為年輕時最好保持單身。你需要生活和玩樂。你也需要自由，想做什麼就做什麼，想什麼時候做就什麼時候做。二十多歲時單身可以讓你有很多時間去旅行、看世界和體驗不同的事物。大多數人在二十多歲時喜歡單身，然後在三十多歲時想要安定下來。我認為人生後期單身可能會很悲傷。你所有的朋友都結婚了或有伴侶，人們外出和派對的次數也減少了。我認為老了以後單身會非常孤獨。你單身的時間越長，就越難安定下來。在一些國家，如果你在人生後期還是單身，人們會認為你很奇怪。

cards.title: Birthdays
cards.question: Birthdays are brilliant. I’m 62 years old and I still love them. I don’t think I’ve ever had a bad birthday. In fact, I think birthdays get better and better the older you become. Sure, kids love birthdays because they get presents and get to eat cake. But when you get older, birthdays make you feel special. It’s your special day. Even if no one wishes you a happy birthday, it’s still your special day. A lot of my friends think I’m mad. They hate their birthdays because it means they’re another year older. I hope I get to celebrate my hundredth birthday. I’m not sure if I can blow out 100 candles though. When I look back at all my birthdays, it’s difficult to choose the best. I’ll just say my last birthday is always the best one.
cards.answer: 生日真是太棒了。我今年62歲了，我仍然喜歡過生日。我不認為我有過任何不好的生日。事實上，我認為生日會隨著年齡的增長而變得越來越好。當然，孩子們喜歡生日，因為他們會收到禮物和吃蛋糕。但當你長大後，生日會讓你感到特別。這是你的特別日子。即使沒有人祝你生日快樂，它仍然是你的特別日子。我很多朋友認為我瘋了。他們討厭自己的生日，因為這意味著他們又老了一歲。我希望我能慶祝我的一百歲生日。不過我不確定我能不能吹滅100根蠟燭。當我回顧我所有的生日時，很難選擇最好的一個。我只會說我最近的生日總是最好的。

cards.title: Blood
cards.question: I hate the sight of blood. Looking at it makes me go all weak at the knees. I can’t even look at my own blood. I don’t know why. The thing I hate most is giving blood for a medical check. I fainted once after I saw my blood in a small bottle. If I have a nose bleed, I have to sit down for 30 minutes before I feel better. It’s impossible for me to watch operations on TV. I wish I could donate blood to others. I can’t. I know giving blood is really important, but I’m not brave enough. One thing about blood I do find interesting is blood types. I think your blood type can affect your personality. I know that in some countries, people with blood type A would not be a good romantic match for someone with blood type O.
cards.answer: 我討厭看到血。看到它會讓我兩腿發軟。我甚至不能看自己的血。我不知道為什麼。我最討厭的事情是做醫學檢查時抽血。有一次我看到小瓶子裡的血後暈倒了。如果我流鼻血，我必須坐下來30分鐘才能感覺好一些。我不可能在電視上看手術。我希望我能給別人捐血。我不能。我知道獻血真的很重要，但我不夠勇敢。關於血液我確實覺得有趣的一件事是血型。我認為你的血型會影響你的性格。我知道在一些國家，A型血的人不會是O型血的人的好的浪漫對象。

cards.title: Books
cards.question: Don’t you think books are the best thing in the world? I can’t remember a time in my life when I wasn’t reading a book. I still have memories of being in my school library when I was about five years old. I have been a bit of a bookworm since then. You’ll usually see me with my head buried in a book. I love all kinds of books. Novels are great for getting to know other worlds and cultures. A good book is one where you never want the story to end. I also like autobiographies because I think it’s interesting to read about people’s lives. Encyclopedias are cool too – you can learn everything about everything in these. I still prefer books to the Internet. Books need to be in your hand and made of paper.
cards.answer: 你不覺得書是世界上最好的東西嗎？我不記得生活中有什麼時候不在讀書的。我仍然記得大約五歲時在學校圖書館的情景。從那以後我就成了一個書蟲。你通常會看到我埋頭在書裡。我喜歡各種各樣的書。小說很適合了解其他世界和文化。一本好書是你永遠不希望故事結束的那種。我也喜歡自傳，因為我認為閱讀人們的生活很有趣。百科全書也很酷——你可以從這些書中學到關於一切的一切。我仍然更喜歡書而不是網路。書需要在你手中，由紙製成。

cards.title: Bullying
cards.question: I’ve never understood bullying. Why do people have to make the life of another person so miserable? Why do they think they have the right to punch and kick someone they think is weaker than them. I was bullied when I was a child. It was a living hell. I was really afraid to go to school, for many, many years. I knew I was not safe during break times. It was always a group of bullies that got me in the corridors, or on the playing fields. They made me hate school. I know they also changed me for life. I have no confidence now. I’m 32 years old but I’m afraid to speak up for myself. The school bullies took away my belief in myself. They didn’t know that they would scar me for life. The physical scars have gone but not the emotional ones.
cards.answer: 我從來不理解霸凌。為什麼人們要讓另一個人的生活如此悲慘？為什麼他們認為他們有權打和踢他們認為比他們弱的人？我小時候被霸凌過。那是活生生的地獄。很多很多年來，我真的很害怕去上學。我知道在休息時間我不安全。總是一群霸凌者在走廊裡或操場上抓住我。他們讓我討厭學校。我知道他們也永遠改變了我。我現在沒有自信。我32歲了，但我害怕為自己說話。學校的霸凌者奪走了我對自己的信念。他們不知道他們會給我留下終身的傷疤。身體上的傷疤已經消失了，但情感上的傷疤沒有。

cards.title: Business
cards.question: Business isn’t so good at the moment. In fact, it’s the worst time for businesses for decades. Many businesses are going bust because of the global financial crisis. Even sound businesses like the car industry and electronics are going through a really bad time. Many small businesses have gone out of business. It’s a real shame because so many lives are being ruined. With a lot of businesses it’s a real fight for survival. I really respect people for trying to make a go of their business. I don’t have much business sense. I wouldn’t know where to start in opening my own business. I suppose the best thing would be to look at business startups on the Internet. An online business might be good. There seems to be less risk.
cards.answer: 現在生意不太好。事實上，這是幾十年來企業最糟糕的時期。由於全球金融危機，許多企業正在倒閉。即使是像汽車工業和電子產品這樣穩健的企業也在經歷非常艱難的時期。許多小企業已經倒閉了。這真是太遺憾了，因為這麼多人的生活都被毀了。對於很多企業來說，這是一場真正的生存之戰。我真的很尊重那些努力經營自己生意的人。我沒有太多商業頭腦。我不知道從哪裡開始開自己的公司。我想最好的辦法是在網路上尋找創業機會。網路生意可能不錯。風險似乎比較小。

cards.title: Busy
cards.question: Are you busy? Do you lead a busy life? It seems we get busier and busier in our lives. I hate being busy. I’d much rather have nothing to do. Being busy makes me stressed and I end up making mistakes or forgetting something. Who’s the busiest person you know? I bet he or she is really stressed. The busy people I know are always looking ahead to their next holiday… and then in their holiday they are busy doing other things. I think we busy ourselves with too many things. We need to learn to relax and take things slowly. Even at work we have to look busy, even if we’re not. When the boss comes, we tell our friends, “Look busy!” That’s silly. It would be great if the word ‘busy’ disappeared from the English language.
cards.answer: 你忙嗎？你過著忙碌的生活嗎？我們的生活似乎越來越忙。我討厭忙碌。我寧願什麼都不做。忙碌讓我感到壓力，最後會犯錯或忘記事情。你認識的最忙的人是誰？我敢打賭他或她壓力真的很大。我認識的忙碌的人總是期待著下一個假期……然後在假期裡他們又忙著做其他事情。我認為我們讓自己忙於太多事情。我們需要學會放鬆，慢慢來。即使在工作中，我們也必須看起來很忙，即使我們不忙。當老闆來的時候，我們告訴朋友「看起來忙一點！」這很傻。如果「忙」這個詞從英語中消失就好了。

cards.title: Calories
cards.question: Do you ever think about or worry about the number of calories you eat and drink every day. It’s not really something I thought about when I was younger. But now I have to think about my calorie intake. I’m putting on weight and so need to be more careful with what I eat. This is difficult because all of the yummiest food has the most calories. I’ve found an answer to this problem. If I do lots of exercise, I can eat what I want and not have to worry about calories. I burn off 500 calories when I jog for an hour. This means I can have a pizza and dessert and not feel guilty. I wish there was more information about calories in restaurants. It would make it easier for me to know what to eat and what to avoid.
cards.answer: 你有沒有想過或擔心過你每天吃喝的卡路里數量？這不是我年輕時真正考慮過的事情。但現在我必須考慮我的卡路里攝入量。我正在長胖，所以需要更注意我吃什麼。這很困難，因為所有最美味的食物都有最多的卡路里。我找到了這個問題的答案。如果我做很多運動，我可以想吃什麼就吃什麼，不用擔心卡路里。我慢跑一小時會燃燒500卡路里。這意味著我可以吃披薩和甜點而不感到內疚。我希望餐廳裡能有更多關於卡路里的資訊。這會讓我更容易知道該吃什麼和該避免什麼。

cards.title: Carbon Footprint
cards.question: We have to do something about pollution. Even though there are warnings about global warming, companies don’t do anything to reduce pollution. Our sky, air, rivers, beaches and countryside are becoming rubbish dumps. The air is so polluted it is giving children breathing problems. Polluted rivers have no fish left in them and beaches are too dangerous to walk on because of the garbage everywhere. It seems a lot of people don’t care. I think there should be big fines for polluters. I don’t mind paying more for things if they can be made with less pollution. The problem is that companies are more interested in profits than pollution. We have only just started looking at our carbon footprint.
cards.answer: 我們必須對污染採取一些措施。儘管有關於全球暖化的警告，公司卻不採取任何措施來減少污染。我們的天空、空氣、河流、海灘和鄉村正在變成垃圾場。空氣污染如此嚴重，正在使兒童出現呼吸問題。被污染的河流裡已經沒有魚了，海灘因為到處都是垃圾而太危險無法行走。似乎很多人都不在乎。我認為應該對污染者處以高額罰款。如果東西能以較少的污染製造，我不介意多付錢。問題是公司更關心利潤而不是污染。我們才剛剛開始關注我們的碳足跡。

cards.title: Careers
cards.question: Choosing a career is one of the biggest decisions we make in life. It used to be that we chose only one career. People would start a job when they were 18, 19 or 20 and stay in that same career for life. Their career path was quite straightforward. Nowadays, it is normal for people to change careers, five, six, seven times. New technology and globalization means things change quickly. We need to study and keep up with all the changes. I’ve had four different careers now. I like moving from one job to another. It means life never gets boring. It’s much better to keep learning different things in different careers. I have no idea what career I’ll choose next. Perhaps one that doesn’t even exists today.
cards.answer: 選擇職業是我們人生中做的最重要的決定之一。以前我們只選擇一個職業。人們在18、19或20歲開始工作，並在同一職業中待一輩子。他們的職業道路相當簡單。現在，人們換五、六、七次職業是正常的。新技術和全球化意味著事情變化很快。我們需要學習並跟上所有的變化。我現在已經有四個不同的職業了。我喜歡從一份工作換到另一份工作。這意味著生活永遠不會無聊。在不同的職業中不斷學習不同的東西要好得多。我不知道我下一個會選擇什麼職業。也許是一個今天還不存在的職業。

cards.title: Cars
cards.question: Are you into cars? My brother is. He’s car crazy. He buys car magazines, watches car programmes on TV and spends hours looking at car websites. He knows the name, maker, engine size and top speed of every car on the planet. Every time we go out, he talks non-stop about the cars he sees. I like cars. They are interesting. If I had a lot of money, I’d like to buy a sports car. I’m saving up for a small car at the moment. I’ll probably buy a hybrid car that is good for the environment. My brother thinks these are boring. He says a car should be powerful and fast. I don’t agree. I think cars should get you from A to B and be big enough for me and my friends. I also prefer smaller cars because they are easier to park.
cards.answer: 你喜歡汽車嗎？我哥哥喜歡。他對汽車瘋狂。他買汽車雜誌，看電視上的汽車節目，花幾個小時看汽車網站。他知道地球上每一輛車的名字、製造商、引擎大小和最高速度。每次我們出去，他都不停地談論他看到的汽車。我喜歡汽車。它們很有趣。如果我有很多錢，我想買一輛跑車。我現在正在攢錢買一輛小車。我可能會買一輛對環境有益的混合動力車。我哥哥認為這些很無聊。他說汽車應該強大而快速。我不同意。我認為汽車應該能讓你從A點到B點，並且大到可以容納我和我的朋友。我也更喜歡小車，因為它們更容易停車。

cards.title: Cats
cards.question: I love cats because they are independent. They help us relax by letting us pet them. You can play with them too. Making them chase a piece of string or a beam of light is very funny, indeed. But a drawback of having a cat is that they can be too talkative. My cat always meows when she wants to eat. And she tries to make us give her our food when we are eating, especially when we are having fish for dinner. On the order hand, owning a cat has its advantages. For example, they catch mice and other small animals. For cats, catching and giving small animals to their owners is a sign of generosity. Sometimes my cat brings animals who are not dead into the house. I really don't like it when she does that.
cards.answer: 我喜歡貓，因為它們很獨立。它們讓我們撫摸它們來幫助我們放鬆。你也可以和它們玩。讓它們追逐一根繩子或一束光真的很有趣。但養貓的一個缺點是它們可能太愛說話了。我的貓想吃東西時總是喵喵叫。當我們吃飯時，她試圖讓我們把食物給她，特別是當我們吃魚的時候。另一方面，養貓也有它的優點。例如，它們會抓老鼠和其他小動物。對貓來說，抓住並把小動物給主人是慷慨的表現。有時候我的貓會把沒死的動物帶進家裡。我真的不喜歡她這樣做。

cards.title: Chickens
cards.question: Chickens are so important to many of us because they are a major part of our diet. Every country has so many chicken dishes, and eggs are one of the most common foods around. Chickens are also cute. Well, chickens aren’t, but chicks are - cute, fluffy chicks that make everyone go ‘aaahh’. It’s strange though that the word ‘chicken’ is used in so many English idioms. When I was at high school, you couldn’t ‘chicken out’ – to not do something because of being scared. Things are different today - I’m no spring chicken (that means I’m no longer young) so no one calls me a chicken any more. I work now - as a teacher. I get chicken feed (low wages) but I like my job. I plan to retire before I’m 50, but I’m not going to count my chickens before they’re hatched. This means I won’t quit working until I have enough money.
cards.answer: 雞對我們許多人來說非常重要，因為它們是我們飲食的重要組成部分。每個國家都有很多雞肉菜餚，蛋是最常見的食物之一。雞也很可愛。嗯，雞不可愛，但小雞可愛——可愛、毛茸茸的小雞讓每個人都發出「啊」的聲音。不過很奇怪的是，「chicken」這個詞在很多英語成語中使用。當我上高中時，你不能「膽怯退縮」（chicken out）——因為害怕而不做某事。今天情況不同了——我不再是年輕人了（no spring chicken），所以沒有人再叫我膽小鬼了。我現在工作——當老師。我賺得很少（chicken feed），但我喜歡我的工作。我計劃在50歲前退休，但我不會過早樂觀（count my chickens before they are hatched）。這意味著在我有足夠的錢之前，我不會辭職。

cards.title: Children
cards.question: Children are angels. Most of the time this is true. I’m very lucky because my two children really are the greatest angels. I think I won the children lottery with my kids. I could not have asked for lovelier, happier, sweeter little children. They have brought me endless amounts of joy since the second they were born. Everything they do fascinates me. Everything they say makes me smile. Watching them grow up is my greatest pleasure. In a way, it’s a little sad. I always want them to stay the age they’re at now. When they were 18 months old, I thought that was the cutest age. I thought the same when they were two, and then three and then four. I guess however old they are, they’re perfect. I wish all the children in the world were as happy as mine.
cards.answer: 孩子是天使。大多數時候這是真的。我很幸運，因為我的兩個孩子真的是最棒的天使。我想我在孩子方面中了彩票。我不可能要求更可愛、更快樂、更甜蜜的小孩了。從他們出生的那一秒起，他們就給我帶來了無盡的快樂。他們做的每件事都讓我著迷。他們說的每句話都讓我微笑。看著他們長大是我最大的樂趣。在某種程度上，這有點悲傷。我總是希望他們能保持現在的年齡。當他們18個月大時，我認為那是最可愛的年齡。當他們兩歲、三歲、四歲時，我也這麼想。我想無論他們多大，他們都是完美的。我希望世界上所有的孩子都像我的孩子一樣幸福。

cards.title: Chocolate
cards.question: Anyone who does not absolutely love chocolate is mad. I don’t think I know anyone who dislikes it. Some of my friends say they hate white chocolate or dark chocolate, but then they like some other kind. I think chocolate is one of the best inventions ever. It is also one of life’s true pleasures. There’s nothing better than having your whole mouth full of chocolate and letting it melt. I love pushing the chocolate up against the roof of my mouth and then moving it all around. Yum. I eat chocolate every day. I know it’s bad for our teeth and makes us fat, but I don’t care. I prefer to think about the health benefits of chocolate. I’ve read many articles that say chocolate is good for us.
cards.answer: 任何不絕對喜歡巧克力的人都是瘋了。我不認為我認識任何不喜歡它的人。我的一些朋友說他們討厭白巧克力或黑巧克力，但他們喜歡其他某種巧克力。我認為巧克力是有史以來最好的發明之一。它也是生活中真正的樂趣之一。沒有什麼比讓整個嘴巴充滿巧克力然後讓它融化更好的了。我喜歡把巧克力推到上顎然後在嘴裡移動。好吃。我每天都吃巧克力。我知道它對牙齒不好，會讓我們發胖，但我不在乎。我更喜歡想巧克力對健康的好處。我讀過很多文章說巧克力對我們有益。

cards.title: Christmas
cards.question: I think Christmas is one of the happiest times of the year. Everyone has a smile on their face, especially children. It’s such an exciting time for kids. They can’t wait to open their presents and play with all of their new games and toys. It’s a nice time for adults too. They can catch up with their families and relax. Traditionally, the mother of the family is busiest at Christmas. She does most of the Christmas shopping and wraps the presents. Of course, she also spends hours cooking Christmas dinner. Let’s not forget the true meaning of Christmas, though. It is not about shopping and Christmas trees and ‘Frosty the Snowman’. It’s all about love for each other and peace around the world. Let’s hope this message stays alive.
cards.answer: 我認為聖誕節是一年中最幸福的時光之一。每個人臉上都掛著笑容，特別是孩子們。對孩子們來說這是一個如此令人興奮的時刻。他們迫不及待地想打開禮物，玩所有新的遊戲和玩具。對大人來說也是一個美好的時光。他們可以和家人團聚並放鬆。傳統上，家庭中的母親在聖誕節最忙。她負責大部分的聖誕購物並包裝禮物。當然，她還要花幾個小時做聖誕晚餐。但是，我們不要忘記聖誕節的真正意義。它不是關於購物和聖誕樹和「雪人弗羅斯蒂」。它是關於對彼此的愛和世界和平。讓我們希望這個信息能永遠保持活力。

cards.title: Climate Change
cards.question: Climate change is one of the most worrying things for our planet. Many politicians and scientists say it is the biggest danger we face. I read almost every day that climate change is changing the Earth forever. Many species of animal, fish, insect, frog, etc. are dying. The ice caps in the Arctic and Antarctica are melting. Our weather is changing so places are getting warmer, or colder, or are having more and stronger hurricanes. We all need to do our bit so that climate change does not destroy us. It’s important to cut down on things that produce greenhouse gasses. These warm the planet and change the climate. Doing simple things like turning off lights and recycling paper all help.
cards.answer: 氣候變遷是我們星球最令人擔憂的事情之一。許多政治家和科學家說這是我們面臨的最大危險。我幾乎每天都讀到氣候變遷正在永遠改變地球。許多動物、魚類、昆蟲、青蛙等物種正在死亡。北極和南極的冰蓋正在融化。我們的天氣正在改變，所以有些地方變得更熱，或更冷，或有更多更強的颶風。我們都需要盡自己的一份力，讓氣候變遷不會毀滅我們。減少產生溫室氣體的東西很重要。這些會使地球變暖並改變氣候。做簡單的事情，如關燈和回收紙張，都有幫助。

cards.title: Clothes
cards.question: I have too many clothes. I have many clothes I’ve only worn once. Sometimes I even find something at the back of a drawer that I never even wore. I bought it, put it away, and then forgot about it. I’m sure I don’t need so many clothes. I don’t think anyone really needs 11 pairs of jeans and 32 sweaters. I won’t tell you how many pairs of shoes I’ve got. That’s way too embarrassing. The simple truth is I love clothes and I love shopping. Maybe I have a problem. I’m sure I’d be a lot richer if I didn’t buy so many clothes. I like brands, so the clothes I buy are quite expensive. One day I’m going to have a big clearout. I’ll take all the clothes I no longer wear and give them to charity.
cards.answer: 我有太多衣服了。我有很多只穿過一次的衣服。有時候我甚至在抽屜後面發現一件我從來沒穿過的東西。我買了它，放好，然後就忘了。我確定我不需要這麼多衣服。我不認為任何人真的需要11條牛仔褲和32件毛衣。我不會告訴你我有多少雙鞋。那太尷尬了。簡單的事實是我喜歡衣服，我喜歡購物。也許我有問題。我確定如果我不買這麼多衣服，我會富有得多。我喜歡名牌，所以我買的衣服很貴。有一天我會大清理。我會把所有不再穿的衣服捐給慈善機構。

cards.title: Coffee
cards.question: Scientists and doctors can’t make their minds up about coffee. One study says it’s really bad for us and the next report says it’s good for us. I’ve even read that 10 cups a day is good for our brain. I like a cup of coffee at certain times of the day. I must have a coffee first thing in the morning. I can’t survive without my morning coffee. I have another cup or two when I get to work. And that’s it. I never drink coffee after lunchtime. If I do, I can’t sleep at night. The only time I drink coffee in the evening is if I go to a nice restaurant. Coffee seems a lot more complicated these days. When I was younger it was just coffee. Now it’s latte, frappucino and all kinds of other strange words.
cards.answer: 科學家和醫生對咖啡的看法無法達成一致。一項研究說它對我們真的很不好，下一份報告又說它對我們有益。我甚至讀到每天喝10杯對我們的大腦有好處。我喜歡在一天中的某些時間喝一杯咖啡。早上第一件事我必須喝咖啡。沒有早晨的咖啡我無法生存。我到工作後會再喝一兩杯。就這樣了。我從不在午餐後喝咖啡。如果我喝了，晚上我就睡不著。我唯一在晚上喝咖啡的時候是如果我去一家好餐廳。現在咖啡似乎複雜多了。我年輕時它只是咖啡。現在是拿鐵、星冰樂和各種其他奇怪的詞。

cards.title: Computers
cards.question: It’s hard to believe that no one had computers a few years ago. I wonder how people lived. There must have been a lot of paperwork. I can’t imagine writing everything by hand. I also wonder how everything worked without computers. We need computers today for everything. Hospitals, airports, the police… nothing can work without computers. I’m sure I’d be ten times busier than now if I didn’t have a computer. Imagine having to find a piece of paper and an envelope and then walking down the street to mail a letter! I love my computer. It makes everything in my life so convenient. Sure, it freezes and crashes sometimes. Sure I lose some data. But that’s not often. Most of the time my computer is like my best friend.
cards.answer: 很難相信幾年前沒有人有電腦。我想知道人們當時是怎麼生活的。一定有很多文書工作。我無法想像用手寫所有東西。我也想知道沒有電腦一切是怎麼運作的。今天我們所有事情都需要電腦。醫院、機場、警察……沒有電腦什麼都無法運作。如果我沒有電腦，我肯定會比現在忙十倍。想像一下必須找一張紙和一個信封，然後走到街上寄信！我愛我的電腦。它讓我生活中的一切都如此方便。當然，它有時會當機和崩潰。當然我會丟失一些數據。但那不常發生。大多數時候我的電腦就像我最好的朋友。

cards.title: Cosmetic Surgery
cards.question: Would you like to change your face and body? Would you like movie star looks? A lot of people want to do this. They pay lots of money to go to a cosmetic surgeon and change their appearance. The most common operation we call a nose job. People who are unhappy with their nose have it reshaped. Other people want their wrinkles to disappear to make themselves look younger. People also go under the knife and have things made bigger or smaller. I think this is a waste of money. I'm not the best-looking person in the world but I would never consider plastic surgery - even if it was free. Some people have so many operations they end up looking like they’re  made of plastic. I'd rather stay looking human.
cards.answer: 你想改變你的臉和身體嗎？你想要電影明星的外表嗎？很多人想這樣做。他們花很多錢去找整形外科醫生改變他們的外表。最常見的手術我們稱之為隆鼻。對自己鼻子不滿意的人會把它重新塑形。其他人想讓他們的皺紋消失，讓自己看起來更年輕。人們也會動刀讓東西變大或變小。我認為這是浪費錢。我不是世界上最好看的人，但我永遠不會考慮整形手術——即使它是免費的。有些人做了太多手術，最後看起來像塑膠做的。我寧願保持人類的樣子。

cards.title: Cosmetics
cards.question: I wish we didn’t need cosmetics. We spend so much time and money on them. And for what? We take them off at night, only to put them all on again in the morning. If you think about it. they’re amazingly expensive. Why does a lipstick or a small tube of cream cost so much? The really expensive cosmetics don’t actually make you look that different than really cheap ones. A lot depends too on your skill – choosing the right colours to match your face, and how you put your make-up on. I sometimes laugh at the ladies selling cosmetics in department stores. They’re meant to be experts but they look like clowns. I mean, do they really need to paint their faces? One thing I worry about is whether the chemicals damage your skin.
cards.answer: 我希望我們不需要化妝品。我們花這麼多時間和金錢在上面。為了什麼？我們晚上把它們卸掉，早上又把它們全部塗上。如果你想一想，它們貴得驚人。為什麼一支口紅或一小管乳霜要這麼貴？真正昂貴的化妝品實際上不會讓你看起來和真正便宜的有多大不同。這也很大程度取決於你的技術——選擇適合你臉的顏色，以及你如何化妝。我有時會笑百貨公司賣化妝品的女士。她們應該是專家，但她們看起來像小丑。我的意思是，她們真的需要畫那麼多臉嗎？我擔心的一件事是化學物質是否會損害你的皮膚。

cards.title: Credit Cards
cards.question: Many years ago I read that credit cards were the thing of the future. Credit card companies were telling us that plastic would replace cash. Well, this hasn’t happened. People are still using notes and coins. The Internet has increased the use of credit cards, but many people worry about putting their card details online. Lots of personal info gets stolen by fake sites pretending to be famous banks or online stores. Personally, I love credit cards. I always prefer to pay by card than by cash. When you use your card, you get air miles and every six months you can cash them in for presents. I do worry about credit card security. I keep waiting to see a huge purchase on my statement that I didn’t make.
cards.answer: 很多年前我讀到信用卡是未來的東西。信用卡公司告訴我們塑膠會取代現金。嗯，這沒有發生。人們仍然在使用紙幣和硬幣。網路增加了信用卡的使用，但很多人擔心把他們的卡資訊放到網上。很多個人資訊被假網站竊取，這些假網站假裝是著名的銀行或網上商店。就我個人而言，我喜歡信用卡。我總是更喜歡用卡而不是現金付款。當你使用你的卡時，你會得到航空里程，每六個月你可以把它們兌換成禮物。我確實擔心信用卡的安全。我一直等著看我的帳單上有一筆我沒有做的巨額購買。

cards.title: Crime
cards.question: Why do we have crime? When will it all stop? It’s sad that there is so much crime in our society. It hurts so many people. Most people in the world just want to live happily and be good neighbours. Why do some people turn to crime? Money is a big reason. Many criminals pickpocket, steal, kidnap, or even kill people to get money. There are many terrible crimes in the world. Perhaps the worst is ethnic cleansing. This is a crime against humanity. Many people are killed because of their colour or religion. People who commit this crime rarely go to prison. Have you ever been a victim of crime? What do you think we need to do to reduce crime rates? Perhaps you should write to your government. Tell your leaders enough is enough.
cards.answer: 為什麼我們有犯罪？它什麼時候才會停止？我們社會中有這麼多犯罪真是令人悲傷。它傷害了這麼多人。世界上大多數人只是想幸福地生活，做好鄰居。為什麼有些人會走上犯罪道路？金錢是一個很大的原因。許多罪犯扒竊、偷竊、綁架，甚至為了得到錢而殺人。世界上有很多可怕的犯罪。也許最糟糕的是種族清洗。這是反人類罪。很多人因為他們的膚色或宗教而被殺。犯這種罪的人很少進監獄。你曾經是犯罪的受害者嗎？你認為我們需要做什麼來降低犯罪率？也許你應該寫信給你的政府。告訴你的領導人夠了。

cards.title: Culture
cards.question: I’m really interested in the culture of other countries. I don’t know why, but I always think other cultures are more interesting than my own culture. Every time I travel, I learn wonderful, strange, amazing and interesting things about other cultures. One of the biggest surprises I had was when I went to the USA as a child. I’m English so I thought Americans had the same culture as me. When I went to America I understood Americans and Brits are very different people. Understanding the culture of other people is very important. It helps us all to get along. If everyone really tried to learn about other cultures, the world would be a more peaceful place. The world is becoming smaller, so I think this is happening.
cards.answer: 我對其他國家的文化真的很感興趣。我不知道為什麼，但我總是認為其他文化比我自己的文化更有趣。每次我旅行，我都會學到關於其他文化的奇妙、奇怪、驚人和有趣的事情。我最大的驚喜之一是我小時候去美國。我是英國人，所以我以為美國人和我有相同的文化。當我去美國時，我明白了美國人和英國人是非常不同的人。了解其他人的文化非常重要。它幫助我們所有人和睦相處。如果每個人都真正努力了解其他文化，世界會是一個更和平的地方。世界正在變小，所以我認為這正在發生。

cards.title: Current Events
cards.question: I love the news and current events. I’m addicted to what’s happening in the world. It doesn’t matter what kind of news it is, I love watching it. Even if it’s from countries I’ve never heard of. I’ll even watch the same news programme three or four times and not get bored. I guess it’s so fascinating because it’s real. I get really interested in a story when it breaks, then like to follow it as it unfolds. Following current events makes you quite knowledgeable. I know most of the world’s capitals and most of the world’s leaders. Watching the news is really looking at history happening now. But you never know what’s going to happen next. Every time you turn on the news or read a news story, you’ll find something unexpected.
cards.answer: 我喜歡新聞和時事。我對世界上發生的事情上癮。不管是什麼類型的新聞，我都喜歡看。即使是來自我從未聽說過的國家。我甚至會看同一個新聞節目三四次而不感到無聊。我想這是因為它是真實的，所以很吸引人。當一個故事爆發時，我會非常感興趣，然後喜歡跟隨它的發展。關注時事讓你非常有知識。我知道世界上大多數國家的首都和大多數國家的領導人。看新聞實際上是在看歷史正在發生。但你永遠不知道接下來會發生什麼。每次你打開新聞或閱讀新聞故事，你都會發現意想不到的東西。

cards.title: Cyber Crime
cards.question: I don’t think people understand cyber-crime. It’s only just started. In the future, it’s going to be a huge problem. There have already been a few amazing examples. A few years ago the whole Internet in Latvia was attacked by another country. Cyberspace has become a new battleground. Countries spy on each other. If there’s a war, it’s possible one country could attack the other country’s Internet. This would mean all communication, transport, etc would stop. It would cause huge damage to hospitals and other important buildings. But cyber-crime is happening today to ordinary people. Have you ever heard of phishing? That’s with a ‘ph’ not ‘f’. You really need to be very careful about what information you put online.
cards.answer: 我不認為人們理解網路犯罪。它才剛剛開始。在未來，這將是一個巨大的問題。已經有一些驚人的例子。幾年前，拉脫維亞的整個網路被另一個國家攻擊。網路空間已經成為一個新的戰場。國家之間相互監視。如果有戰爭，一個國家可能會攻擊另一個國家的網路。這意味著所有的通訊、交通等都會停止。它會對醫院和其他重要建築造成巨大損害。但網路犯罪今天正在發生在普通人身上。你聽說過網路釣魚嗎？那是用「ph」而不是「f」。你真的需要非常小心你在網上放的資訊。

cards.title: Cyber Bullying
cards.question: The Internet can be a scary place these days, especially because of cyber-bullying. It’s difficult to open a newspaper these days and not see a story about this. It’s a really nasty and growing problem. Cyber-bullies are real cowards. They hide behind their computer and scare people, send them hate mail or threaten them. Even worse is when they publish pictures of their victims online. I have a friend who had a really bad time at the hands of a cyber-bully. He or she spread lots of gossip and lies on the Internet. My friend’s reputation was badly damaged. A really bad thing is how young cyber-bullying starts. Many schoolchildren physically bully others in class and then continue online. Their victim isn’t safe anywhere.
cards.answer: 現在網路可能是一個可怕的地方，特別是因為網路霸凌。這些天很難打開報紙而看不到關於這個的故事。這是一個非常惡劣且不斷增長的問題。網路霸凌者是真正的懦夫。他們躲在電腦後面嚇唬人，發送仇恨郵件或威脅他們。更糟糕的是當他們在網上發布受害者的照片。我有一個朋友在網路霸凌者手中經歷了非常糟糕的時期。他或她在網上散布很多流言和謊言。我朋友的名譽受到嚴重損害。一件非常糟糕的事情是網路霸凌開始得多早。許多學童在課堂上身體霸凌他人，然後在網上繼續。他們的受害者在任何地方都不安全。

cards.title: Dancing
cards.question: I have loved dancing ever since I can remember. It was a part of my life when I was growing up and it is still important to me now. It has to be the best way to exercise. What can be better than dancing to your favourite songs? I love going to clubs and discos. I can dance all night long. I never get tired of it. When I was small, I used to go to school discos. I’d also dance at the parties my parents, friends and neighbours had. I don’t think I’ll ever stop dancing. I also love looking at dancing. Ballet is beautiful. Dances from all over the world are beautiful. I think the life of a professional dancer must be a good one. One thing that always amazes me is how much children love dancing. I think dancing must be in their blood.
cards.answer: 從我記事起我就喜歡跳舞。它是我成長過程中的一部分，現在對我來說仍然很重要。這絕對是最好的運動方式。有什麼比跟著你最喜歡的歌曲跳舞更好的呢？我喜歡去俱樂部和迪斯可。我可以整晚跳舞。我永遠不會厭倦。我小時候常常去學校舞會。我也會在我父母、朋友和鄰居舉辦的派對上跳舞。我不認為我會停止跳舞。我也喜歡看舞蹈。芭蕾很美。來自世界各地的舞蹈都很美。我認為專業舞者的生活一定很好。一件總是讓我驚訝的事情是孩子們多麼喜歡跳舞。我認為跳舞一定在他們的血液裡。

cards.title: Danger
cards.question: Danger is everywhere. It’s all around us. That what I’ve decided. I thought about danger the other day and decided we live in a dangerous world. Even our house is full of danger. There are many chemicals in our cosmetics, cleaners, fridges, computers that are not good for us. The electric wiring could go wrong and electrocute us. We could fall down the stairs or slip on the kitchen floor. And then when we leave our house, we enter a dangerous world. Cars travelling at speed, people holding cigarettes, construction workers with heavy objects above our heads… all of these things present danger. Just turn on the news or open a local paper to see how much danger there is. I think I’ll stay in bed today.
cards.answer: 危險無處不在。它就在我們周圍。這是我得出的結論。前幾天我想到了危險，並決定我們生活在一個危險的世界裡。即使我們的房子也充滿了危險。我們的化妝品、清潔劑、冰箱、電腦裡有很多對我們不好的化學物質。電線可能出問題電到我們。我們可能會從樓梯上摔下來或在廚房地板上滑倒。然後當我們離開家時，我們進入一個危險的世界。高速行駛的汽車，手裡拿著香煙的人，建築工人在我們頭頂上拿著重物……所有這些東西都呈現危險。只要打開新聞或打開當地報紙，就能看到有多少危險。我想我今天還是待在床上吧。

cards.title: Death
cards.question: People say that death is the only thing in life that is certain. That’s true. I’m not afraid of dying, but I do think it’s a sad thing. I’d like to live forever. I like life. I want to see my children’s children’s children grow up. People have different views on death in different cultures. In some countries, you die and go to heaven. In other countries you die and come back to Earth as something else. Some people celebrate people’s death because they had a good life. In other countries, death is a sad and dark affair. I know of many countries where death is a taboo subject. People just don’t talk about it. I have no problems talking about death. Especially to my family. I think it’s useful to tell everyone what I want to happen when I die.
cards.answer: 人們說死亡是生命中唯一確定的事情。這是真的。我不怕死，但我確實認為這是一件悲傷的事情。我想永遠活著。我喜歡生活。我想看到我的孩子的孩子的孩子長大。不同文化的人對死亡有不同的看法。在一些國家，你死後去天堂。在其他國家，你死後會以其他形式回到地球。有些人慶祝人們的死亡，因為他們有美好的一生。在其他國家，死亡是一件悲傷和黑暗的事情。我知道很多國家死亡是一個禁忌話題。人們就是不談論它。我談論死亡沒有問題。特別是和我的家人。我認為告訴每個人我死後想發生什麼是有用的。

cards.title: Dentists
cards.question: I’m afraid of the dentist. Always have been, for as long as I can remember. Even if the dentist is really, really kind and gentle, I’m still afraid. Even if the dental surgery is colourful and there’s relaxing music, I’m still afraid. Dentists for me haven’t changed a bit. When I was a child, I hated the sound of the drill. That sound is still there today. When I was young, I hated the smell. Same smell today. I can’t wait for the day scientists invent something so we never need dentists. The strange thing is, when I was younger, I wanted to be a dentist. I thought it would be good to treat people just like me. I felt I would understand others who have the same fear. I think I would have been a good dentist.
cards.answer: 我害怕牙醫。一直都是，從我記事起。即使牙醫真的、真的很友善和溫柔，我仍然害怕。即使牙科診所很漂亮，有輕鬆的音樂，我仍然害怕。對我來說牙醫一點都沒變。我小時候，我討厭鑽頭的聲音。那個聲音今天還在。我年輕時，我討厭那個味道。今天還是同樣的味道。我迫不及待等待科學家發明一些東西，讓我們永遠不需要牙醫。奇怪的是，我年輕時想成為一名牙醫。我以為治療像我這樣的人會很好。我覺得我會理解其他有同樣恐懼的人。我想我會是一個好牙醫。

cards.title: Diamonds
cards.question: There’s a famous song that says “Diamonds are a girl’s best friend”. Is that true? Do all women like diamonds? They are certainly very beautiful, especially when you see them sparkling. But really, only rich people can afford diamonds. When I bought my wife’s wedding ring, we could only afford a smallish diamond. There were lots of beautiful rings in the store with huge diamonds but they all cost an arm and a leg. One day I’ll buy her a big diamond as a surprise. Nowadays you have to worry where diamonds come from. Many countries sell diamonds to buy guns and tanks. These are called blood diamonds. If you buy a diamond, make sure it has a certificate so you know which country it came from.
cards.answer: 有一首著名的歌說「鑽石是女孩最好的朋友」。這是真的嗎？所有女人都喜歡鑽石嗎？它們確實非常美麗，特別是當你看到它們閃閃發光的時候。但實際上，只有富人才能負擔得起鑽石。當我買我妻子的結婚戒指時，我們只能買得起一顆小一點的鑽石。店裡有很多帶大鑽石的漂亮戒指，但它們都貴得離譜。有一天我會買一顆大鑽石給她作為驚喜。現在你必須擔心鑽石來自哪裡。許多國家出售鑽石來購買槍支和坦克。這些被稱為血鑽石。如果你買鑽石，確保它有證書，這樣你就知道它來自哪個國家。

cards.title: Digital Cameras
cards.question: Digital cameras are so useful. I love my digital camera. I take it everywhere with me. My friends think I’m mad, but I’ve got thousands of really good photos. Digital cameras are so much better than the old cameras with film. They’re also much better than mobile phone cameras. My digital camera fits in my pocket and takes great photos. I usually take a few photos every day and then put them online for my friends to see. The best thing about digital cameras is that they are so easy to use. It’s child’s play. The good thing is that digital cameras today give the same quality photos as you could only get on really expensive cameras. All you need is 10 to 12 megapixels. That’s more than enough.
cards.answer: 數位相機太有用了。我喜歡我的數位相機。我到處都帶著它。我的朋友認為我瘋了，但我有數千張非常好的照片。數位相機比用膠卷的老相機好多了。它們也比手機相機好得多。我的數位相機可以放進我的口袋裡，拍出很棒的照片。我通常每天拍幾張照片，然後把它們放到網上讓朋友們看。數位相機最好的地方是它們非常容易使用。這是小孩子都會玩的。好消息是，今天的數位相機提供的照片質量和以前只有在非常昂貴的相機上才能得到的一樣。你只需要10到12百萬畫素。那已經足夠了。

cards.title: Directions
cards.question: I’m hopeless at giving directions. I get very confused. I’m sure I send people in totally the wrong direction. For some reason, I always get stopped for directions in the street. I can usually direct someone if it’s just a block or two, but that’s it. If it’s half way across town, I’ll send you in the opposite direction, guaranteed. The funniest thing is asking for directions in another language. I’m pretty good at saying where I want to go, but when I receive the directions, I understand nothing. I nod my head and smile and say “thank you very much”. The person walks away thinking I understood the directions. I’m impressed by people who can give directions from one town to another. They must have a map inside their head!
cards.answer: 我不擅長指路。我會很困惑。我確定我把人們指向完全錯誤的方向。出於某種原因，我在街上總是被人問路。如果只是一兩個街區，我通常可以指路，但僅此而已。如果是城鎮的另一邊，我保證會把你指向相反的方向。最有趣的事情是用另一種語言問路。我很擅長說我想去哪裡，但當我收到指示時，我什麼都不懂。我點頭微笑說「非常感謝」。那個人走開時以為我理解了指示。我很佩服那些能從一個城鎮指路到另一個城鎮的人。他們腦子裡一定有一張地圖！

cards.title: Disability
cards.question: I think disability can be a difficult thing to understand. It's a word that means many different things. A disability can affect people's body, intelligence and emotions. It makes it more difficult for people to do everyday things properly. Disabled people might tell us something different. Many people with disabilities show us how strong the human spirit is. There are so many people who have been badly injured in accidents, or who were disabled from birth, who are world-class athletes or excel in other areas. It must be hard to deal with disability if it comes to you suddenly. In richer countries, there are support systems to help these people. In poorer countries, they can have a really tough time. Hopefully this will change one day.
cards.answer: 我認為殘疾可能是一件很難理解的事情。這是一個意味著很多不同事情的詞。殘疾可以影響人們的身體、智力和情感。它使人們更難正常做日常事情。殘疾人可能會告訴我們不同的事情。許多殘疾人向我們展示了人類精神有多麼強大。有這麼多在事故中受傷嚴重或天生殘疾的人，他們是世界級的運動員或在其他領域出類拔萃。如果殘疾突然降臨到你身上，這一定很難處理。在較富裕的國家，有支持系統來幫助這些人。在較貧窮的國家，他們可能會經歷非常艱難的時期。希望有一天這會改變。

cards.title: Discrimination
cards.question: I don’t understand discrimination. To me, it’s evil. How can you not think that all people are the same? It doesn’t matter what kind of discrimination it is, it’s all terrible. People who discriminate because of other people’s race, sex or age should be named and shamed. I think there should be really strong laws against all forms of discrimination. Racism is horrible. What difference does it make what colour your skin is? The thing that surprises me is that even in the most cosmopolitan cities, racism is everywhere. Sexual discrimination is also stupid. Sexist people have sisters, mothers, wives, daughters; but they still treat women as being less able. I wonder if we'll ever live in a world where we’re all equal.
cards.answer: 我不理解歧視。對我來說，它是邪惡的。你怎麼能不認為所有人都是一樣的？不管是什麼類型的歧視，都是可怕的。因為其他人的種族、性別或年齡而歧視的人應該被點名批評。我認為應該有非常嚴格的法律來反對所有形式的歧視。種族主義是可怕的。你的膚色有什麼區別？讓我驚訝的是，即使在最國際化的城市，種族主義也無處不在。性別歧視也很愚蠢。有性別歧視的人有姐妹、母親、妻子、女兒；但他們仍然把女性視為能力較差的人。我想知道我們是否會生活在一個我們都平等的世界裡。

cards.title: Diseases
cards.question: One day, all diseases on Earth will be gone. I wonder. In fact, if all diseases die out or doctors find vaccines and cures for them, that will really change our planet. Think about the amount of overpopulation if no one died from diseases. There’d be a population explosion. I don’t think the Earth would be able to feed so many people. It’s a really difficult question. Some diseases in the world are really horrible and cause a lot of suffering. It would be great if scientists found cures for those. Scientists have already found a cure for many diseases. It’s amazing how far science and medicine have come. I think more cures for diseases could be found if governments spent more money. They seem to spend so little on controlling disease.
cards.answer: 有一天，地球上所有的疾病都會消失。我想知道。事實上，如果所有疾病都消失了，或者醫生找到了疫苗和治療方法，那將真正改變我們的星球。想想看，如果沒有人死於疾病，會有多少人口過剩。會有人口爆炸。我不認為地球能養活這麼多人。這是一個非常困難的問題。世界上有些疾病真的很可怕，造成很多痛苦。如果科學家能找到治療方法就太好了。科學家已經找到了許多疾病的治療方法。科學和醫學取得的進步是驚人的。我認為如果政府投入更多的錢，可以找到更多疾病的治療方法。他們似乎在控制疾病上花的錢太少了。

cards.title: Divorce
cards.question: Divorce is on the increase around the world. It seems divorce rates are rising in pretty much every country you read about. I know in my country, divorce is now not unusual. More than thirty per cent of marriages end in divorce. I suppose it’s easier nowadays to get a divorce, and it’s more socially acceptable. I know it was more difficult to get divorced 50 years ago. People thought that there was something wrong with you if you were a divorcee. Today, it’s common to get through two, three, even more marriages. Perhaps people should think a bit more before they get married. Divorce is pretty hard on children. When a divorce gets ugly, the kids really suffer. Sorting out divorce settlements can be a messy business.
cards.answer: 離婚在世界各地都在增加。似乎你讀到的幾乎每個國家的離婚率都在上升。我知道在我的國家，離婚現在已經不罕見了。超過百分之三十的婚姻以離婚告終。我想現在離婚更容易了，而且在社會上更被接受。我知道50年前離婚更困難。如果你是離婚者，人們會認為你有問題。今天，經歷兩次、三次，甚至更多婚姻是很常見的。也許人們在結婚之前應該多想想。離婚對孩子來說相當艱難。當離婚變得醜陋時，孩子們真的會受苦。解決離婚協議可能是一件很麻煩的事情。

cards.title: Doctors
cards.question: Doctors are cool. They spend all their day helping people and saving lives. There can’t be many better jobs in the world. I wanted to be a doctor when I was a kid but I was no good at science. I think doctors are among the most important people in society. They should get paid lots and lots of money. It’s not right that bankers get paid more. Doctors are really clever and very kind. They never seem to panic or get angry. Every time I’ve seen a doctor, he or she has always made me feel better – not just because of their treatment, but also because of their kindness. It must be amazing being a doctor and knowing all kinds of stuff about the human body. It would be pretty useful being a doctor because then you’d know what was wrong with your own body.
cards.answer: 醫生很酷。他們整天都在幫助人們和拯救生命。世界上不可能有很多更好的工作了。我小時候想成為醫生，但我的理科不好。我認為醫生是社會中最重要的人之一。他們應該得到很多很多的錢。銀行家賺得更多是不對的。醫生真的很聰明，非常善良。他們似乎從不恐慌或生氣。每次我看醫生，他或她總是讓我感覺好一些——不僅僅是因為他們的治療，還因為他們的善良。當醫生並且知道關於人體的各種知識一定很驚人。當醫生會很有用，因為那樣你就知道自己的身體出了什麼問題。

cards.title: Dogs
cards.question: There’s an old English saying that says, “A dog is a man’s best friend”. This is true for many people – men and women. Most people I know love dogs. They are pretty cool animals. They are intelligent and very helpful. Dogs are a real member of the family if you have one as a pet. I think dogs are very useful. They keep you company, they bark if a stranger comes near your house, and they fetch your slippers. Not all dogs are nice, though. Some are dangerous. I get sad when I read in the paper about children being attacked by a dog. Owners need to train them better. I also get sad when I read about abandoned dogs. People who want a dog as a pet should get an abandoned one.
cards.answer: 有一句古老的英語諺語說，「狗是人類最好的朋友」。對許多人來說這是真的——男人和女人。我認識的大多數人都喜歡狗。它們是相當酷的動物。它們很聰明，非常有幫助。如果你養一隻狗作為寵物，它們是家庭的真正成員。我認為狗非常有用。它們陪伴你，如果陌生人靠近你的房子它們會吠叫，它們會幫你拿拖鞋。不過不是所有的狗都是好的。有些是危險的。當我在報紙上讀到孩子被狗攻擊時，我會很傷心。主人需要更好地訓練它們。當我讀到被遺棄的狗時，我也會傷心。想養狗作為寵物的人應該領養一隻被遺棄的狗。

cards.title: Dreams
cards.question: I dream almost every night. I have a lot of dreams and I remember most of them. I’m not sure what they mean. Some of them are quite strange. One day I’ll have to buy a book on dreams and see if I can interpret them. When I was a little kid, I had really bad dreams. Real scary ones. They were probably nightmares rather than dreams. Usually it was some big, bad stranger chasing me. My dreams today are all very different. Sometimes I’m speaking in another language in my dream. The ones I don’t like are the ones where I’m falling. But I my dreams where I’m flying. I sometimes have really nice dreams, but then my alarm clock goes off. I press snooze and try and get back into my dream for another ten minutes.
cards.answer: 我幾乎每晚都做夢。我做很多夢，而且我記得大部分。我不確定它們是什麼意思。有些相當奇怪。有一天我必須買一本關於夢的書，看看我能不能解釋它們。我小時候做過非常糟糕的夢。真正可怕的夢。它們可能是噩夢而不是夢。通常是一些大的、壞的陌生人在追我。我今天的夢都非常不同。有時候我在夢裡說另一種語言。我不喜歡那些我在墜落的夢。但我喜歡我在飛的夢。我有時做非常美好的夢，但然後我的鬧鐘響了。我按下貪睡鍵，試著在接下來的十分鐘裡回到我的夢裡。

cards.title: Driving
cards.question: Driving is one of life’s greatest pleasures. There’s nothing better than getting behind the wheel and going for a drive. I live in the countryside, so it’s easy to get out onto an open road. I open the windows and turn the music up and then just drive and drive. I like driving to new areas and finding new roads. I find it very relaxing and great fun. I like the speed and the freedom. I even like driving in towns and cities, although not when traffic is really heavy. It’s not much fun being stuck in a traffic jam half the day. Driving in different countries is great fun. I’m a little nervous at first, but I soon get to know the roads. People have different ways of driving in different countries. I don’t like countries that have aggressive drivers.
cards.answer: 開車是人生最大的樂趣之一。沒有什麼比坐在方向盤後面開車更好的了。我住在鄉下，所以很容易開到空曠的路上。我打開車窗，把音樂調大，然後就一直開。我喜歡開車去新的地方，發現新的道路。我覺得非常放鬆，也很有趣。我喜歡速度和自由。我甚至喜歡在城鎮和城市裡開車，雖然不喜歡交通非常擁擠的時候。塞在車陣裡半天不太有趣。在不同國家開車很有趣。一開始我有點緊張，但很快就熟悉了道路。不同國家的人有不同的駕駛方式。我不喜歡有攻擊性司機的國家。

cards.title: Drugs
cards.question: Drugs are becoming a big problem in many societies. When I was growing up, you rarely heard about drugs. Now, they’re everywhere. Children in schools are smoking marijuana and taking harder drugs. There were many kids at my school who smoked. Nicotine was the most serious drug they used. Today’s kids seem to have access to all kinds of drugs. I don’t know what the government should do about it. Some countries have legalized drugs like marijuana, but others have made it a crime to possess even the smallest amount. You can even go to prison for having a tiny, tiny bit. Governments need to do something before society ends up in a real mess. I’m not sure what the solution is.
cards.answer: 毒品在許多社會中正在成為一個大問題。我長大的時候，你很少聽到毒品。現在，它們到處都是。學校裡的孩子在抽大麻和吸食更強的毒品。我學校裡有很多孩子抽煙。尼古丁是他們使用的最嚴重的藥物。今天的孩子似乎能接觸到各種毒品。我不知道政府應該怎麼做。一些國家已經將大麻等毒品合法化，但其他國家則將持有哪怕是最少量的毒品定為犯罪。你甚至可能因為持有一點點毒品而入獄。政府需要在社會陷入真正的混亂之前採取行動。我不確定解決方案是什麼。

cards.title: E Mail
cards.question: E-mail certainly keeps me busy. I never used to write as many letters as I do now. In the good old days before computers, we wrote real letters, with paper and envelopes. I wrote one or two letters a week. But now, with e-mail, my in-box is never empty. There’s always someone mailing me. I would like just one day where I’m free of e-mail. The sad thing is, very few mails I get are interesting. I get loads of spam – junk mail trying to sell me things I don’t want. I also get lots of mail from people asking me to do stuff. Do this, do that, reply ASAP. It’s too much sometimes. The one good thing about e-mail is that you can get things done quickly. I can e-mail a company in another country and they can mail me back in two minutes.
cards.answer: 電子郵件確實讓我很忙。我以前從來沒有寫過這麼多信。在電腦之前的美好舊時光，我們寫真正的信，用紙和信封。我一週寫一兩封信。但現在，有了電子郵件，我的收件箱從來不是空的。總是有人給我發郵件。我希望能有一天不用處理電子郵件。可悲的是，我收到的郵件很少是有趣的。我收到很多垃圾郵件——試圖向我推銷我不想要的東西的垃圾郵件。我還收到很多人的郵件要求我做事情。做這個，做那個，儘快回覆。有時候太多了。電子郵件的一個好處是你可以快速完成事情。我可以給另一個國家的公司發郵件，他們可以在兩分鐘內回覆我。

cards.title: Eating
cards.question: Eating is the best thing ever. I love eating. Any time of the day or night I can eat…. and eat and eat and eat. I have a very big appetite. I always have. My mother used to complain about how much I ate. She used to ask me if I had a hole in my stomach. Eating is very, very satisfying. There are many different aspects of eating. It fills us up and stops us feeling hungry. Food tastes so good and eating it makes us feel very happy. Sometimes I feel like I’m in heaven when I’m eating – especially chocolate fudge cheesecake. Yum. Eating is also a great social activity. I love eating with my family, with my friends or even at work. Eating can also be an international experience. Eating is great just about anywhere you eat.
cards.answer: 吃飯是有史以來最棒的事情。我喜歡吃飯。一天中任何時候我都可以吃……而且吃了又吃又吃。我胃口很大。一直都是這樣。我媽媽過去常常抱怨我吃得太多。她過去常問我是不是胃裡有個洞。吃飯非常、非常令人滿足。吃飯有很多不同的方面。它填飽我們，讓我們不再感到飢餓。食物味道太好了，吃它讓我們感到非常快樂。有時候吃東西的時候我覺得自己在天堂——特別是巧克力軟糖起司蛋糕。好吃。吃飯也是一項很棒的社交活動。我喜歡和家人、朋友甚至在工作時一起吃飯。吃飯也可以是國際體驗。幾乎在任何地方吃飯都很棒。

cards.title: Education
cards.question: Education is one of the most important things in our lives. Don’t you agree? It can make the difference between success and failure. An education can bring us knowledge and make us rich. In rich countries, people are lucky to have good schools. Children start learning from a very young age. They can further their education and go to higher education or university. In Japan, there are even private schools for babies to learn English. It’s a shame that in many rich countries, many children don’t want to learn. Perhaps schools need to find better ways to teach so children want to learn. It’s sad that in many parts of the world, children want to learn but can’t. Make sure you never stop learning. Education is the key to a better future.
cards.answer: 教育是我們生活中最重要的事情之一。你不同意嗎？它可以決定成功與失敗。教育可以帶給我們知識並使我們富有。在富裕國家，人們很幸運有好學校。孩子們從很小的年齡就開始學習。他們可以繼續深造，進入高等教育或大學。在日本，甚至有嬰兒學英語的私立學校。可惜的是，在許多富裕國家，很多孩子不想學習。也許學校需要找到更好的教學方法，讓孩子們想學習。令人難過的是，在世界許多地方，孩子們想學習卻不能。確保你永不停止學習。教育是通往更美好未來的鑰匙。

cards.title: Eggs
cards.question: Eggs are great. Where would we be without them? They are so useful. I can’t imagine life or cooking without them. There are many ways of cooking eggs for breakfast – fried eggs, scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, etc. There are even many ways of “cooking” these. You can have a runny or hard fried egg or even have it sunny side up. You can have soft or hard-boiled eggs and fluffy scrambled eggs. There are also many things to put on top of eggs – mayonnaise, ketchup, salt, soy sauce. Each country has something different. I like cooking with eggs. I particularly like breaking them. I can now do it with one hand, without breaking the yolk. Sometimes it gets messy and the egg white starts dripping down your arm.
cards.answer: 雞蛋很棒。沒有它們我們會怎麼樣？它們太有用了。我無法想像沒有雞蛋的生活或烹飪。早餐有很多種烹飪雞蛋的方法——煎蛋、炒蛋、水煮蛋等。甚至有很多種「烹飪」這些的方法。你可以要流黃或全熟的煎蛋，甚至可以要太陽蛋。你可以要軟的或硬的水煮蛋和蓬鬆的炒蛋。雞蛋上面也有很多東西可以放——蛋黃醬、番茄醬、鹽、醬油。每個國家都有不同的東西。我喜歡用雞蛋做飯。我特別喜歡打蛋。我現在可以單手打蛋，而且不打破蛋黃。有時候會弄得很亂，蛋白開始從你手臂上滴下來。

cards.title: Electricity
cards.question: Electricity is one of the most important inventions ever. It is the thing that powers the Earth. If there was no electricity, we’d be back in the dark ages. Few people stop and think just how amazing electricity is. With the flick of a switch, you can power almost anything. Think about what would happen if there was no electricity. We’d have no TV, no computers, no traffic signals. It would be like going back to living in caves. There are a few negative points about electricity, of course. Number one, it’s dangerous. Thousands of people die each year from electrocuting themselves or in electrical fires. And number two, it isn’t good for the environment. Most electricity comes from burning coal and that creates greenhouse gasses.
cards.answer: 電是有史以來最重要的發明之一。它是驅動地球的東西。如果沒有電，我們就會回到黑暗時代。很少有人停下來想想電是多麼神奇。只要按一下開關，你就可以為幾乎任何東西供電。想想如果沒有電會發生什麼。我們沒有電視、沒有電腦、沒有交通信號燈。那就像回到住在洞穴裡一樣。當然，電也有一些負面的地方。第一，它很危險。每年有數千人死於觸電或電氣火災。第二，它對環境不好。大部分電力來自燃燒煤炭，這會產生溫室氣體。

cards.title: Emergencies
cards.question: Are you a good person to have around in an emergency? I am, I think. I have a very cool head and I don’t panic easily. The most important thing to do in an emergency is stay calm. If you do this, you can think straight and decide what’s best to do. Also, if you stay calm, other people might stay calm too. The worst thing to do is panic. Once you panic, things become worse. Of course, it depends on the kind of emergency. For really serious emergencies, you should call the emergency services. That’s 999 in the UK or 911 in other parts of the world. My biggest emergency recently was a big one. I pressed the delete button and lost my 3,000 songs in iTunes. Luckily, I had a back-up.
cards.answer: 在緊急情況下你是一個值得信賴的人嗎？我想我是。我頭腦很冷靜，不容易恐慌。在緊急情況下最重要的事情是保持冷靜。如果你這樣做，你就可以清楚地思考並決定什麼是最好的做法。另外，如果你保持冷靜，其他人也可能保持冷靜。最糟糕的事情是恐慌。一旦你恐慌，事情就會變得更糟。當然，這取決於緊急情況的類型。對於真正嚴重的緊急情況，你應該打緊急服務電話。在英國是999，在世界其他地方是911。我最近最大的緊急情況是一個大問題。我按了刪除鍵，丟失了我iTunes裡的3000首歌。幸運的是，我有備份。

cards.title: Energy
cards.question: My energy levels go up and down. Sometimes I’m full of energy, and sometimes I’m drained of energy. Mornings are when my energy levels are high. I wake up ready to go. I don’t need 30 minutes to wake up, like some people I know. For some reason the food I eat doesn’t affect how energetic I am. Some people feel tired after lunch, while others complain they need to eat something for an energy boost. I seem to have the same level of energy even if I eat nothing all day. The one thing that does affect my energy is the weather. A bright, sunny day gives me lots of energy. A dull, rainy day makes me feel less energetic. I also have a lot of energy if I’m doing something exciting – even if it’s study or work.
cards.answer: 能源是一個大問題。我認為大多數人沒有意識到這個問題有多大。我們使用了太多的能源。最大的問題是發電廠需要燃燒東西來發電。這意味著燃燒化石燃料，如石油和煤炭。這對環境造成了很大的損害。好消息是現在有很多關於可再生能源的研究。一些國家正在建造大型風力發電廠。太陽能也變得越來越便宜。我們真的需要改變我們使用能源的方式。我們家裡所有的電器、我們的汽車、我們的生活方式——都使用太多能源。我們需要更加節能。

cards.title: English
cards.question: I’m a bit shy when I have to speak in English. I’m a little worried about making mistakes. I also still lack confidence. Many of my friends don’t worry about mistakes. They just talk and talk. They always get their message across, even if their grammar is wrong. I think this is the best thing to do. My teacher always says it’s best to learn by doing. If I don’t try to speak English, I’ll never be able to use it when I need it. One thing I started doing recently was talking to myself. I have short conversations with myself. I think it works. I also make short stories about people and say them aloud. I do this in my room, of course. People would think I’m crazy if I did it in class or on the train.
cards.answer: 英語是世界上最重要的語言。我認為大多數人都同意這一點。英語是國際商務和科學的語言。如果你想在世界任何地方工作，英語會給你帶來很大的優勢。我喜歡英語這門語言。它是一種非常靈活的語言。你可以用很多不同的方式說同樣的事情。它也有很多有趣的表達方式和成語。我認為英語最難的部分是拼寫。英語的拼寫非常不規則。另一個困難是發音。英語單詞的發音方式和它們的拼寫方式經常不同。但總的來說，英語是一種美麗的語言，學習它很有趣。

cards.title: Evolution
cards.question: I learnt all about evolution when I was about ten years old. I remember it clearly. I thought it was amazing. My mind was full of images of strange creatures crawling out of a green, soupy lake. Fish that had somehow developed legs and the ability to breathe air. Then these creatures turned into all kinds of animals. All the books I read said we came from apes. Scientists are still not sure how. There’s a missing link. When I think about it now, the theory of evolution is a clever concept. The man who thought of it, Charles Darwin, said nature is all about the survival of the fittest. Only the strongest species survive. We are still evolving. Scientists believe we will look quite different a million years from now. I wonder what we’ll look like.
cards.answer: 我在大約十歲的時候學到了有關進化的所有知識。我清楚地記得那個時刻。我覺得這非常神奇。我的腦海中充滿了奇異生物從綠色的濁湖中爬出的畫面。那些魚不知怎的發展出了腿和呼吸空氣的能力。然後這些生物變成了各種各樣的動物。我讀過的所有書籍都說我們來自猿類。科學家們仍然不確定具體是怎麼回事。存在著一個缺失的環節。現在回想起來，進化論是一個巧妙的概念。提出這個理論的人，查爾斯·達爾文，說自然界就是適者生存。只有最強的物種才能存活下來。我們仍在進化中。科學家們相信，從現在起一百萬年後，我們的樣子會有很大不同。我想知道我們會變成什麼樣子。

cards.title: Exercise
cards.question: Exercise is something most of us love to hate. A lot of us avoid it altogether. I do a lot of exercise, but not because I like it. I do it because it helps me stay slim and healthy. I always feel great after exercising, so there are good parts to it. The thing I hate most is getting ready. It’s really difficult after a hard day’s work to come home and then prepare for your exercises. I really don’t want to do it when I’m getting changed. I hate the warm-up stretching. I also hate the first few minutes of a run, swim or cycle. But then once my lungs stop burning, I settle into a rhythm and things aren’t so bad. Recently I bought an exercise bike. Sitting in my house cycling to loud music or watching TV is a great way to get some exercise.
cards.answer: 運動對你有好處。每個人都知道這一點。但問題是找時間做運動。我總是很忙，當我有空閒時間時，我太累了不想運動。我知道我應該做更多的運動。醫生總是告訴我。我試過健身房，但我覺得很無聊。我試過跑步，但我的膝蓋開始疼。我發現最好的運動是走路。它不會太累，你可以去不同的地方。我現在試著每天走至少三十分鐘。我注意到我感覺更好了，睡得更好了。運動也對你的心情有好處。當我運動後，我總是感到更快樂。

cards.title: Factories
cards.question: I have a strange hobby. It’s visiting factories. I’m really interested to see how things work and how they are made. I’ve learnt so many things on my factory visits. Factories are amazing. They are like mini cities. The thing that surprises me most is how everything works together. Everyone knows exactly what to do and when to do it. Even the robots. Car factories are cool, but very noisy. A car assembly line is like a giant ballet dance with everything moving perfectly together. It’s quite easy to visit factories. All you have to do is go to their home page and see if they have visiting times, or write to them. The best factories to visit are ones that produce food and drinks. You always get free stuff. Unfortunately you don’t get a free car at car factories.
cards.answer: 我有一個奇怪的愛好，就是參觀工廠。我對於事物的運作方式和製造過程非常感興趣。在我的工廠參觀中，我學到了許多東西。工廠真是令人驚奇，它們就像迷你城市。最讓我驚訝的是一切是如何協同運作的。每個人都知道自己該做什麼以及何時去做，連機器人也是如此。汽車工廠很酷，但非常嘈雜。汽車組裝線就像一場巨大的芭蕾舞，所有的動作都完美協調。參觀工廠其實很簡單。你只需訪問他們的主頁，查看是否有參觀時間，或者直接寫信給他們。最值得參觀的工廠是那些生產食品和飲料的工廠，因為你總能獲得免費的東西。不幸的是，在汽車工廠你不會得到一輛免費的車。

cards.title: Family
cards.question: What does family mean to you? In a perfect world, all families should be happy and everyone should get on well together. I know a lot of families that have many problems. Brothers and sisters who don’t like each other, parents who never talk to each other. I wonder why this is. How can you live so close to your family members and feel apart from them? There is a lot of talk in the news about the breakdown of family life. Divorce is rising everywhere in the world. This means single parents have less time to spend with their children, which creates problems. Maybe the stress of modern life puts too much pressure on families. It seems as though family life was better a generation or two ago. Is this true for families in your country?
cards.answer: 家庭對我來說非常重要。我認為家庭是生活中最重要的東西之一。無論發生什麼，你的家人總是在你身邊。他們愛你本來的樣子。他們支持你度過好時光和壞時光。我和家人很親近。我們經常一起吃飯，一起慶祝節日。我們也會互相幫助解決問題。當然，家庭關係並不總是容易的。我們有時會吵架。但這就是家庭的方式。你可以和家人爭吵，然後又和好。我認為現代生活使家庭關係更加困難。人們太忙了，沒有時間陪家人。我們需要記住家庭的重要性。

cards.title: Famine
cards.question: There is no way that famine should be a problem in today’s world. We are so rich. Companies have billions of dollars. Countries have trillions. It’s a real shame that people do not give enough to help famine victims. It’s a sin. There is more than enough food in this world to feed everyone. Government leaders need to tell the world why they let people die of hunger. Even the United Nations can’t persuade governments to give enough money to help the starving. Of course, there are good governments and bad ones. The bad ones often let their own people starve. The leaders steal the country’s money. Some countries have a famine but their state TV tells people there are bumper crops. That’s shocking.
cards.answer: 在今天的世界中，饑荒不應該成為一個問題。我們如此富有。企業擁有數十億美元，國家則有數萬億。人們不夠慷慨去幫助饑荒受害者，這真是可惜。這是一種罪過。這個世界上有足夠的食物來養活每一個人。政府領導人需要告訴世界，為什麼他們讓人們死於飢餓。即使是聯合國也無法說服各國政府提供足夠的資金來幫助飢餓者。當然，有好的政府，也有壞的政府。壞的政府往往讓自己的人民挨餓。領導者竊取國家的財富。有些國家面臨饑荒，但他們的國家電視卻告訴人們有豐收，這真是令人震驚。

cards.title: Fashion
cards.question: Have you ever thought how strange fashion is? People tell us what clothes to wear. That’s weird. Fashion stores tell us what is “in” this summer or this winter. People then buy the same clothes and look like everyone else because they want to feel trendy. The thing is, fashion is about being an individual, but then we all wear clothes that are the same as everyone else’s! Keeping up with fashion is expensive these days. Everyone is into brand fashion. Have you seen how much the most fashionable sneakers are? How can kids afford those? The craziest fashion is the luxury brands. People spend a month’s salary, or more, on a handbag or watch. That’s crazy. I’m happy with an unknown brand at half the price. I don’t mind being unfashionable.
cards.answer: 時尚不是我最感興趣的事情。我不理解為什麼人們在衣服上花這麼多錢。衣服只是用來保暖和遮體的。時尚每年都在變化，所以如果你想跟上潮流，你必須不斷買新衣服。這對我來說是浪費錢。我更喜歡穿舒適的衣服。我不在乎它們是不是最新的款式。我認為時尚界也有很多問題。快時尚對環境不好。製作便宜衣服的工人經常受到剝削。我認為我們應該買更少但質量更好的衣服，穿更長時間。質量比數量重要。

cards.title: Fast Food
cards.question: Do you like fast food? Lots of people complain about it but I think a lot of it’s quite tasty – as long as you go to one of the international chains like McDonalds or Kentucky. I think in today’s world, it’s difficult to avoid eating in fast food restaurants. They are so convenient and seem to be everywhere. Of course they’re not the same as real restaurants. I wonder if they are restaurants. There aren’t any waiters. Anyway, the most important thing to remember about fast food is that it isn’t so healthy. People who eat it every day develop health problems. I don’t understand why schools serve fast food during lunch time. Schools should encourage students to eat healthily.
