It won’t get me there any quicker. It will only make me look really panicked when I get there. I also panic if I think I’ve lost an important computer file. I don’t panic, though, in emergency situations. I think I’m good at staying calm and helping others. There have been a few times when people asked me how I could stay so cool. I guess everyone is different. Imagine what it’s like to be a soldier. Do they panic? Do police officers and fire-fighters panic? They always keep a cool head. A lot of people panicked recently in the financial crisis. Losing money always makes people panic.
cards.answer: 你會感到恐慌嗎？我有時會，雖然我喜歡認為自己不是。在重要的事情上遲到時，我會感到恐慌。在這種情況下，恐慌真的沒有好處。這不會讓我更快到達目的地，反而只會讓我到達時看起來非常慌亂。如果我認為自己丟失了一個重要的電腦檔案，我也會感到恐慌。不過，在緊急情況下我不會恐慌。我覺得自己在保持冷靜和幫助他人方面做得不錯。有幾次人們問我怎麼能保持如此冷靜。我想每個人都不同。想像一下當兵的感受。他們會感到恐慌嗎？警察和消防員會感到恐慌嗎？他們總是能保持冷靜。最近在金融危機中，很多人感到恐慌。失去金錢總是讓人感到恐慌。

cards.title: Paper
cards.question: I think paper is one of the best inventions ever. Without paper, we would all still be farmers. The discovery of paper was the start of the first information technology revolution. OK, it’s not very technological, but it did change our lives. We started to write down our history; we wrote down poems and books and plays. We also wrote our holy books on paper. Then, one day, many centuries ago, someone invented the printing press. Suddenly, people printed hundreds, thousands, millions of books. Society changed because more and more people could read. We became educated. We can’t live without paper today. Even though we have the Internet, we still love reading real newspapers; we still read real books; and we still write messages on paper.
cards.answer: 我認為紙張是最偉大的發明之一。沒有紙張，我們仍然會是農民。紙的發現標誌著第一次信息技術革命的開始。好吧，這並不是非常技術化，但它確實改變了我們的生活。我們開始記錄歷史；我們寫下詩歌、書籍和戲劇。我們還在紙上寫下了聖書。然後，在幾個世紀前的某一天，有人發明了印刷機。突然之間，人們開始印刷數百、數千、數百萬本書籍。社會因此發生了變化，因為越來越多的人能夠閱讀。我們變得受過教育。今天，我們無法離開紙張。即使我們擁有互聯網，我們仍然喜歡閱讀真正的報紙；我們仍然閱讀真正的書籍；我們仍然在紙上寫下信息。

cards.title: Parenting
cards.question: Being a parent is the biggest responsibility we can have in our lives. It’s scary if you think about it. You have to look after a tiny baby for years and years. It is your duty to make sure that little baby grows up into a wonderful, happy and responsible human being. Parenting means knowing everything from day one. This is a shock to many parents. I didn’t have any parenting lessons. I suddenly had a baby to look after. But it’s not that scary. In fact, parenting is life’s biggest joy. I can’t put into words how wonderful it is to be a parent. My biggest worry is that society doesn’t focus on parenting. We really should have classes at school on being good parents. I’m sure we would reduce the number of problems in society if we did this.
cards.answer: 成為父母是我們生活中最大的責任。如果仔細想想，這是令人畏懼的。你必須照顧一個小嬰兒多年。確保這個小嬰兒成長為一個美好、快樂且負責任的人是你的責任。育兒意味著從第一天起就要了解一切。這對許多父母來說都是一個震驚。我並沒有接受過任何育兒課程，卻突然有了需要照顧的嬰兒。但其實並沒有那麼可怕。事實上，育兒是生活中最大的快樂。我無法用言語形容成為父母的美妙。我的最大擔憂是社會並不重視育兒。我們真的應該在學校開設有關成為好父母的課程。我相信如果這樣做，我們會減少社會上的許多問題。

cards.title: Parks
cards.question: There aren’t enough parks in my town. I don’t know why. I think it’s terrible. I think the biggest reason is greedy property developers. People are more interested in making money from office buildings than making a nice town. We need parks. Our children need somewhere to play. Many people live in apartment buildings so they have no garden, which means we need parks. City planners can’t be very good at their jobs if they don’t make parks. When I was younger, there were parks everywhere. Children could run and run and run. There were big areas of grass. We played football and other games. But they’ve all gone. Now there are shopping malls and car parks where the real parks used to be. Today, children play in the shopping malls. This is not good.
cards.answer: 我所在的城鎮公園實在太少了。我不知道為什麼。我覺得這非常糟糕。我認為最大的原因是貪婪的房地產開發商。人們更關心如何從辦公大樓中賺錢，而不是打造一個宜居的城鎮。我們需要公園。我們的孩子需要一個可以玩耍的地方。許多人住在公寓裡，沒有花園，這意味著我們需要公園。如果城市規劃者不建設公園，那麼他們的工作就不會很好。當我年輕的時候，公園到處都是。孩子們可以盡情地跑來跑去。那裡有大片的草地。我們踢足球和玩其他遊戲。但這些都不復存在了。現在，曾經的公園變成了購物中心和停車場。如今，孩子們在購物中心裡玩耍。這樣可不好。

cards.title: Parties
cards.question: I love parties. They are always so much fun. I can’t think of a better way to spend an afternoon or evening than going to a party. You meet people, eat delicious food, and have lots of fun. I’ve always loved parties. I remember the birthday parties I had as a child. Such wonderful memories. I also remember the first parties I went to as a teenager – all night parties where we danced and chatted until morning. I’ve lost count of the number of parties I’ve been to. Dinner parties, beach parties, New Year’s Eve parties, birthday parties… the list goes on. One party I’d really like to go to is the Queen’s garden party. Of course this is in England. If you go to this party, it means you’ve done something special in life. All I have to do now is think of something special to do!
cards.answer: 我喜歡派對。它們總是充滿樂趣。我無法想像有比參加派對更好的方式來度過一個下午或晚上。你可以認識新朋友，品嚐美味的食物，並享受無窮的樂趣。我一直都喜歡派對。我記得我小時候的生日派對，那些美好的回憶。還有我青少年時期第一次參加的派對——整晚的派對，我們跳舞聊天直到天亮。我已經數不清自己參加過多少派對了。晚宴派對、海灘派對、跨年派對、生日派對……這份名單還在繼續。我特別想參加的一個派對是女王的花園派對。當然，這是在英國。如果你能參加這個派對，那就意味著你在生活中做過一些特別的事情。現在我需要做的就是想出一些特別的事情來做！

cards.title: Passports
cards.question: Passports are interesting things. I wonder who decides their design. Who thinks up the words to put inside? They are also pretty simple things. A passport is really just a tiny book full of empty pages and some personal information and a photo. I’ve always thought it must be easy to make a fake passport. I’ve heard passports sell for a lot of money on the black market, especially American ones. Without a passport we can’t travel. Our passport makes it so easy for us to go anywhere. I love it when my passport gets old because it’s full of visas and entry and exit stamps. Passports were originally for ship passengers, a pass for the ports during a sea journey. Perhaps today they should be called something different.
cards.answer: 護照是件有趣的東西。我想知道是誰決定它們的設計。又是誰想出裡面要放什麼文字？其實它們也相當簡單。護照不過是一本小書，裡面充滿了空白頁面、一些個人資訊和一張照片。我一直覺得製作假護照應該很容易。我聽說護照在黑市上賣得很貴，尤其是美國護照。沒有護照我們就無法旅行。我們的護照讓我們輕鬆地去任何地方。我喜歡我的護照變舊，因為裡面充滿了簽證和出入境的印章。護照最初是為了船上的乘客而設計的，是海上旅程中進出港口的通行證。或許今天它們應該有個不同的名稱。

cards.title: Pasta
cards.question: I love pasta of all kinds. Anything with pasta is always delicious, especially if it’s from Italy. For many countries, pasta is a new addition to the menu. In England just after the war, there was no pasta. Once, a newspaper tricked people with a photo of a spaghetti tree. Today, everyone in England knows about pasta. It’s one of the most popular foods in the world. Spaghetti Bolognese and lasagna are now international dishes. What I don’t know is how many different types of pasta there are. Hundreds, I think; in all different shapes and colours. What I do know is that they are all delicious. Pasta is very versatile because it has so many uses. You can also eat it when it’s hot or when it’s cold.
cards.answer: 我愛各種意大利麵。任何含有意大利麵的料理總是美味可口，尤其是來自義大利的。對於許多國家來說，意大利麵是一個新的菜單選擇。在英國，戰後的時候，根本沒有意大利麵。曾經有一份報紙用一張意大利麵樹的照片來愚弄人們。如今，英國的每個人都知道意大利麵。它是世界上最受歡迎的食物之一。肉醬意大利麵和千層麵現在已經成為國際料理。我不知道有多少種不同類型的意大利麵。我想有幾百種，各種不同的形狀和顏色。我知道的是，它們都是美味的。意大利麵非常多用途，因為它有很多種吃法。你可以熱吃也可以冷吃。

cards.title: Patience
cards.question: People say patience is a virtue. I agree with this. Having patience is a good part of someone’s character. Not everyone has patience. These people get angry and frustrated quickly. They can’t wait. If you have no patience, you want everything to happen right now. Children often have little patience, especially when there’s a present to open. They get really impatient and want to open the gift immediately. We become more patient as we get older. Perhaps we learn how to be more patient. In today’s world, you really need patience because we expect everything to happen straight away and often it doesn’t. I’m quite patient. I need it for my job. I’m a teacher so you need to wait for people to answer and learn.
cards.answer: 人們常說耐心是一種美德。我同意這一點。擁有耐心是個人品格中的一個重要部分。並不是每個人都有耐心。這些人很快就會生氣和沮喪。他們無法等待。如果你沒有耐心，你會希望一切立刻發生。孩子們通常耐心很少，尤其是在有禮物要打開的時候。他們會變得非常不耐煩，想要立即打開禮物。隨著年齡的增長，我們變得更加耐心。也許我們學會了如何變得更有耐心。在今天的世界裡，你真的需要耐心，因為我們期望一切都能立即發生，但往往並非如此。我相當有耐心。我需要這種耐心來應對我的工作。我是一名教師，因此你需要等待學生回答和學習。

cards.title: Peace
cards.question: Peace is the one thing we all hope for in the world. I wonder if it will ever come. It seems so simple, really. Why can’t everyone live in peace? It seems a lot easier to do that than to fight useless wars. If there was peace in the world, everyone’s life would be better. Governments could spend all the money they waste on armies on education and healthcare. We really need peace. There have been too many wars in our history. I would say well over 99 percent of the world’s people want peace. Only a tiny minority doesn’t want peace, although they say they do. World leaders need to think more carefully about how they can achieve peace in the world.
cards.answer: 和平是我們所有人都渴望的事物。我不禁想，它是否會來臨。這似乎真的很簡單。為什麼每個人不能和平共處呢？看起來這比打無謂的戰爭要容易得多。如果世界上有和平，每個人的生活都會更好。各國政府可以把浪費在軍隊上的資金用於教育和醫療。我們真的需要和平。我們的歷史中有太多的戰爭。我敢說，世界上超過99%的人都渴望和平。只有極少數人不想要和平，儘管他們口口聲聲說想要。世界領袖需要更加仔細地思考如何在世界上實現和平。

cards.title: Pensions
cards.question: Do you have a pension? I didn’t have one for many years. I always thought it was strange to start saving in my twenties for life in my seventies. Now, I wish I had started my pension earlier. My pension would be much bigger. The pension my government will give me isn’t so big. It isn’t really enough to survive on. Nowadays people need to think carefully about their pension and how they will get by when they retire. I’m lucky because I live in a country where the government gives you some kind of pension. In many countries, you get nothing. I can’t believe the pensions some people get. When company CEOs retire, they get a multi-million-dollar pension. That doesn’t seem fair. They aren’t better than other people.
cards.answer: 你有退休金嗎？我很多年都沒有退休金。我一直覺得在二十多歲時就開始為七十多歲的生活儲蓄是件奇怪的事。現在，我希望我能更早開始我的退休金計劃。我的退休金會大得多。政府給我的退休金並不算多，實際上根本不足以維持生計。如今，人們需要仔細考慮自己的退休金，以及退休後如何生活。我很幸運，因為我生活在一個政府會提供某種退休金的國家。在許多國家，你什麼都得不到。我無法相信有些人能拿到的退休金。當公司首席執行官退休時，他們能獲得數百萬美元的退休金。這似乎不公平。他們並不比其他人優越。

cards.title: People
cards.question: “People are strange, when they are strangers.” That’s from a famous song. I do agree with it, although I do think all people are strange. It’s a good thing that people are strange. If we were all the same, life would be boring. It’s the fact that we are all strange that makes us all different. I like people from all over the world. It’s sad that all people don’t get along. Many people say I’m strange. I’m not sure why. I always think I’m pretty normal. The people I like best are those who help other people. They make the world a better place. The people I hate most are greedy people. They usually take the things other people need. All people need to think more about how they can help others.
cards.answer: 「人們是奇怪的，當他們是陌生人時。」這句話出自一首著名的歌曲。我同意這個觀點，雖然我認為所有人都是奇怪的。人們奇怪這件事其實是件好事。如果我們都一樣，生活會變得無聊。正是因為我們每個人都有自己的奇特之處，才讓我們彼此不同。我喜歡來自世界各地的人。可惜的是，並不是所有人都能和睦相處。許多人說我很奇怪，我不太明白為什麼。我一直認為自己相當正常。我最喜歡的人是那些幫助他人的人。他們讓世界變得更美好。我最討厭的人是貪婪的人。他們通常會奪走其他人所需的東西。所有人都需要多思考如何能幫助他人。

cards.title: Perfume
cards.question: Who likes perfume? It stinks. It’s one of the worst smells in the world. I hate it when someone walks past me with really strong perfume or cologne. It makes me feel a little sick and I worry about the chemicals in it. Why do people need to wear so much perfume? What’s the point? I thought the original idea of perfume was to cover the smell of our bodies when we didn’t take a bath. Everybody showers or takes a bath these days, so there’s no need for perfume. It’s also a waste of money. How can a tiny bottle of strong-smelling water cost so much? I think the perfume companies are making huge amounts of money. I wonder how many people agree with me on this. What do you think of perfume? Is it OK for men and women?
cards.answer: 誰喜歡香水呢？那味道真糟糕。它是世界上最難聞的氣味之一。我討厭當有人走過我身邊，身上散發著濃烈的香水或古龍水。這讓我感到有些不舒服，還擔心裡面的化學成分。為什麼人們需要噴這麼多香水呢？這樣做的意義何在？我以為香水的最初目的是為了掩蓋我們身體的氣味，當我們沒有洗澡的時候。如今每個人都會淋浴或洗澡，所以根本不需要香水。這也是浪費金錢。怎麼會一小瓶強烈氣味的水要這麼貴呢？我覺得香水公司賺了很多錢。我想知道有多少人和我有相同的看法。你對香水怎麼看？男女都可以用嗎？

cards.title: Personal Problems
cards.question: One of my friends always seems to have personal problems. Sometimes it’s a relationship, sometimes it’s family, and sometimes it’s her. I’m not sure why she has so many personal problems and I think many of her problems aren’t really problems at all. She’s a bit of an attention seeker. I think she invents problems just so she can talk to people. She likes people to feel sorry for her. I think it’s amazing how many people talk about their personal problems on TV or on the radio. Who cares? There are much more important things happening in the world today than someone breaking up with their friend. If you think about all the terrible things happening in the world, our personal problems really aren’t problems at all.
cards.answer: 我有一個朋友總是似乎有個人問題。有時是感情問題，有時是家庭問題，有時則是她自己。我不太明白為什麼她會有這麼多個人問題，而我覺得她的許多問題根本就不算問題。她有點愛引人注意。我覺得她會編造問題，只是為了能和人交談。她喜歡讓人對她感到同情。我覺得很驚訝，竟然有這麼多人在電視或廣播上談論他們的個人問題。誰在乎呢？如今世界上發生的事情比某人和朋友分手要重要得多。如果你想想世界上發生的所有可怕事情，我們的個人問題根本就不算問題。

cards.title: Personality
cards.question: What kind of personality do you have? Do you ever think about your personality? I do. I think it’s very interesting to explore personality. My own personality has changed a lot over the years. When I was a child, I was painfully shy, but now I’m brimming with confidence. I have learned how to be with people and let my true character shine. The personalities of my friends have rubbed off on me, which I’m happy about. There are parts of my personality I’m not too happy with. I’m quick to get angry with people and sometimes I sulk when I don’t get my own way. I think overall I have a good personality. I’m easy to get on with and I’m quite happy and cheerful. I might take some personality tests and see what they say about me.
cards.answer: 你有什麼樣的個性？你有沒有想過自己的個性？我有。我覺得探索個性非常有趣。我的個性這些年來變化很大。小時候我非常害羞，但現在我充滿自信。我學會了如何與人相處，讓我的真實性格閃耀出來。朋友們的個性也影響了我，這讓我感到高興。不過，我對自己某些個性特徵並不太滿意。我對人容易生氣，有時候當事情不如我意時會感到鬱悶。我認為總的來說，我的個性還不錯。我很容易相處，性格也相當快樂和開朗。我可能會做一些個性測試，看看它們對我的評價。

cards.title: Pets
cards.question: Everyone needs a pet. It’s really cool to look after an animal of some kind, or even a bird or insect. I’ve always had pets. When I grew up, we had three dogs, five cats, a tortoise and loads of rabbits. I lost count of the number of rabbits we had. Pets are really important for kids. Looking after a pet teaches the child responsibility. It’s cute looking at the way children play with their pets. They always seem to have so much fun. I wonder if pets like being pets. I think if I were a dog, it’d be a good life to be a pet. I get all my food given to me, I have somewhere warm and dry to sleep and I get to run and play lots. I suppose if you had a bad owner, that wouldn’t be good. One day I want an unusual pet like a tarantula or a scorpion.
cards.answer: 每個人都需要一隻寵物。照顧某種動物，甚至是鳥類或昆蟲，真的很酷。我一直都有寵物。當我長大時，我們家有三隻狗、五隻貓、一隻烏龜和許多兔子。我已經數不清我們有多少隻兔子了。寵物對孩子來說非常重要。照顧寵物教會孩子責任感。看著孩子們和寵物玩耍的樣子真是可愛。他們似乎總是玩得很開心。我在想寵物是否喜歡當寵物。如果我是隻狗，當寵物的生活會很好。我所有的食物都有人提供，我有個溫暖乾燥的地方可以睡覺，還可以盡情奔跑和玩耍。我想如果有一個糟糕的主人，那就不好了。有一天我想要一隻不尋常的寵物，比如狼蛛或蠍子。

cards.title: Philosophy
cards.question: Everyone knows a lot about philosophy, even if they don’t know it. We are all philosophers because we all have views and opinions on life. We don’t all know about the philosophy that people study as a university subject. I know the names of Aristotle, Plato, Nietzsche and Freud, but I don’t really know what philosophy they spoke about. I also know Descarte’s famous quote “I think, therefore I am” but I can’t get too excited about it. I once read a book called “The Tao of Pooh”. It was the philosophy of life according to Winnie the Pooh. I liked reading that more than most philosophy books I’ve tried. My philosophy on life is to always try your best, help those around you, and to always be positive about everything.
cards.answer: 每個人對哲學都有不少了解，即使他們自己並不自覺。我們都是哲學家，因為我們對生活都有自己的看法和意見。並不是每個人都了解作為大學科目所研究的哲學。我知道亞里士多德、柏拉圖、尼采和弗洛伊德的名字，但我並不真正了解他們所談論的哲學。我也知道笛卡兒那句著名的名言「我思故我在」，但我對它並沒有太大的興趣。我曾經讀過一本叫做《小熊維尼的道》的書，這是根據小熊維尼所闡述的生活哲學。我覺得這本書比我試過的許多哲學書籍都更有趣。我的人生哲學是：永遠全力以赴，幫助身邊的人，並對一切保持積極的態度。

cards.title: Phobias
cards.question: Phobias are interesting things. Some of them are very serious and can have a really negative influence on life. The most common phobias are the fear of open spaces or closed spaces and the fear of heights and flying. Doctors say all phobias are treatable. Phobias are irrational fears of something. There is no logical reason why someone is afraid of going outside or of flying. It’s all inside the sufferer’s head. I understand some phobias like the fear of flying, but not others. Some people are afraid of babies, or computers, and even of peanut butter sticking to the roof of your mouth. That phobia has a really long Latin name. I wonder if there’s a phobia about the English language. Perhaps that’s grammarphobia.
cards.answer: 恐懼症是有趣的現象。有些恐懼症非常嚴重，可能對生活產生真正的負面影響。最常見的恐懼症包括對開放空間或封閉空間的恐懼，以及對高處和飛行的恐懼。醫生表示所有的恐懼症都是可以治療的。恐懼症是對某些事物的不理性恐懼。沒有邏輯上的理由解釋為什麼有人會害怕外出或飛行。這一切都存在於患者的腦海中。我能理解一些恐懼症，比如對飛行的恐懼，但對其他一些則無法理解。有些人害怕嬰兒、電腦，甚至是花生醬黏在上顎的感覺。那種恐懼症有一個非常長的拉丁名字。我在想是否存在對英語的恐懼症。也許那就是語法恐懼症。

cards.title: Photography
cards.question: Photography is one of the world’s best-loved hobbies. Recently, it seems as though everyone in the world has become a photographer. It’s so easy now to take good photographs. When I was a teenager, photography was one of my biggest hobbies. I loved taking photos of all kinds of things. I also had a lot of photographic equipment. I couldn’t wait to get my photos developed. Now there are digital cameras and phone cameras. Anyone can take really good photographs. What’s more, we can use all kinds of software to change our photos and display them online. I think photography will get easier and more interesting in the future. I still think great photographers will be like great artists.
cards.answer: 攝影是世界上最受喜愛的愛好之一。最近，似乎全世界的人都成了攝影師。現在拍出好照片變得如此簡單。當我還是青少年的時候，攝影是我最大的愛好之一。我喜歡拍攝各種各樣的事物。我還擁有很多攝影設備。我迫不及待想要沖洗我的照片。現在有了數位相機和手機相機，任何人都能拍出非常好的照片。更重要的是，我們可以使用各種軟體來修改照片並在線展示。我認為在未來，攝影會變得更加簡單和有趣。我仍然認為偉大的攝影師就像偉大的藝術家。

cards.title: Physics
cards.question: I don’t know how people understand physics. I think it’s a fascinating subject and really wish I understood more. Physics seems to explain everything about our world and our universe. It’s as though physics is the key to unlocking all of our world’s mysteries. I really enjoyed studying physics at the beginning. It was interesting then. But then it got difficult and I couldn’t understand the formulae. I have a lot of respect for physicists. They seem to be able to understand lots of really difficult things. Without them, we would still be living very basic lives. Physicists have sent people to the Moon. Their research has led to all of our modern technology. I always read fewer and fewer students are choosing to study physics. This is a shame.
cards.answer: 我不知道人們是如何理解物理學的。我認為這是一個迷人的學科，真的希望我能理解得更多。物理學似乎解釋了我們世界和宇宙中的一切。就好像物理學是解開我們世界所有奧秘的鑰匙。我一開始非常喜歡學習物理，當時覺得很有趣。但後來變得困難，我無法理解那些公式。我對物理學家充滿敬意。他們似乎能夠理解許多非常複雜的事物。沒有他們，我們仍然會過著非常基本的生活。物理學家將人類送上了月球，他們的研究促成了我們所有的現代科技。我總是看到越來越少的學生選擇學習物理，這真是可惜。

cards.title: Picnics
cards.question: Everybody likes picnics. Going on a picnic seems to be a popular activity all over the world. Having a picnic makes everyone happy. There’s usually lots of delicious food and somewhere nice to eat it. I think it’s interesting to see the different things people take on picnics. In England, people take a picnic basket full of sandwiches and cake. In India, people take small metal containers of curry. In Japan, people take square boxes of food that are beautifully presented. I think it’s easy to tell where picnickers are from just from looking at what they bring to the picnic. The great thing about picnics is that they are outside and you can eat and feel the warm sun. I’ve never heard of picnics in the snow, although I guess they might happen somewhere.
cards.answer: 每個人都喜歡野餐。去野餐似乎是全世界都受歡迎的活動。野餐讓每個人都感到快樂。通常會有很多美味的食物和一個舒適的地方來享用它。我覺得觀察人們帶到野餐的不同食物非常有趣。在英國，人們會帶滿是三明治和蛋糕的野餐籃。在印度，人們會帶小金屬容器裝著咖哩。在日本，人們則會帶精美呈現的方形食物盒。我認為僅僅透過他們帶到野餐的食物，就能輕易判斷出野餐者來自哪裡。野餐的美妙之處在於它們是在戶外進行的，你可以一邊吃東西，一邊感受溫暖的陽光。我從未聽說過在雪地裡野餐，雖然我猜可能在某些地方會發生。

cards.title: Pilots
cards.question: Pilots do very important jobs. They have the lives of all their passengers in their hands. I wanted to be a pilot when I was little. I thought it would be great to fly all over the world. I also liked the pilot’s uniform. I wasn’t so good at science so I dropped that idea. I think being an airline pilot is a unique job. It is quite glamorous, it is well paid, you travel and you are your own boss. There’s no one telling you what to do. The pilot just has to get his or her schedule and then fly to the next destination. And they get the best view from the cockpit. I think pilots see some amazingly beautiful things as they fly through the clouds and towards the rising sun. I wonder if pilots ever get fed up of flying.
cards.answer: 飛行員的工作非常重要。他們掌握著所有乘客的生命。我小時候曾經想成為一名飛行員，覺得能夠飛遍世界各地一定很棒。我也喜歡飛行員的制服。不過我在科學方面不太好，所以放棄了這個想法。我認為成為一名航空公司飛行員是一份獨特的工作。這份工作相當迷人，薪水也很好，還能旅行，並且是自己的老闆。沒有人告訴你該怎麼做。飛行員只需要按照自己的時間表飛往下一個目的地。而且他們從駕駛艙裡能看到最美的風景。我想飛行員在穿越雲層、朝著升起的太陽飛行時，會看到一些驚人而美麗的景象。我在想，飛行員是否會對飛行感到厭倦。

cards.title: Pizza
cards.question: Everybody loves pizza. It must be the most popular food in the world. I don’t know anyone who doesn’t like it. I absolutely love pizza. I’ll eat any kind any time of the day or night. Hot pizza, cold pizza, pizza with pineapple, whatever. My favorite pizza is, of course, the traditional type made in Naples in Italy. Just the simple dough with nothing but cheese and tomato – it works for me every time. I remember the first pizza restaurant opening in my town. I was so happy. I tried out all the different toppings and switched between deep-pan crusty pizzas and those with a thin base. I love half-and-half pizzas – you get two tastes for the price of one. I also had all-you-can-eat pizza a few times. Not such a good idea if you worry about your weight.
cards.answer: 每個人都喜歡披薩。這一定是世界上最受歡迎的食物。我不認識不喜歡它的人。我絕對愛披薩。無論什麼時候，我都會吃任何種類的披薩。熱披薩、冷披薩、加菠蘿的披薩，隨便哪一種。我最喜歡的披薩，當然是那種在意大利那不勒斯製作的傳統款式。就只是簡單的麵團，裡面只有起司和番茄——每次都讓我滿意。我記得我所在的城鎮第一家披薩餐廳開業的情景。我當時非常高興。我嘗試了各種不同的配料，並在深盤脆皮披薩和薄底披薩之間切換。我喜歡半半披薩——你可以以一個價格享受兩種口味。我還幾次參加了自助披薩活動。如果你擔心體重，這可不是個好主意。

cards.title: Plagiarism
cards.question: OK everyone, today's topic is plagiarism. If you don't know what that is, it's copying stuff from books or the Internet without letting people know where the stuff came from. Lots of people do it nowadays because copy and paste is so quick and easy. It's OK to copy and paste small chunks of someone's work but you must make it clear it's copied, and write from whom you copied it or where you got it. Put the text in quotation marks and say something like, "according to…" and then put the writer's name. The best thing is to go to the Internet and search for, "how to cite sources". EnglishClub.com has good information on how to do this. The best thing is to make sure what you write is really from your head.
cards.answer: 大家好，今天的主題是抄襲。如果你不知道那是什麼，簡單來說，就是從書籍或互聯網上複製內容，而不告訴別人這些內容的來源。如今很多人都這樣做，因為複製和粘貼非常快速且簡便。複製和粘貼少量他人的作品是可以的，但你必須明確指出這是抄襲，並寫明你是從誰那裡抄的或是從哪裡獲得的。將文本放在引號中，然後說一些像是「根據…」的話，接著寫上作者的名字。最好的方法是上網搜索「如何引用來源」。EnglishClub.com 提供了關於這方面的好資訊。最重要的是，確保你所寫的內容真的是來自你的思考。

cards.title: Planets
cards.question: How did all the planets get there? How is it only our planet has life? Will we ever travel to other planets? These are questions I often think about. I think our planet is the best. It looks so beautiful from space with its mixture of blue and green. The other planets look too strange to me. Mercury is just a red, hot ball, pretty much the same as Mars. Saturn looks like a real planet. Its rings give it an extra-special look. The other planets don’t look that interesting. I don’t really know much about Venus, Neptune, Uranus and Jupiter. When I was at school, we learnt that Pluto was a planet. But now it isn’t. Scientists have decided there are now only eight planets in our solar system and not nine. I wonder why they dropped Pluto.
cards.answer: 所有行星是怎麼形成的？為什麼只有我們的星球擁有生命？我們會不會有一天能夠旅行到其他行星？這些是我經常思考的問題。我認為我們的星球是最棒的。從太空看，它的藍色和綠色交織在一起，顯得如此美麗。其他行星在我看來都太奇怪了。水星只是一顆紅色的熱球，與火星幾乎沒有區別。土星看起來像一顆真正的行星，它的環帶讓它顯得格外特別。其他行星則沒有那麼有趣。我對金星、海王星、天王星和木星了解不多。當我在學校的時候，我們學到冥王星是一顆行星。但現在它不再被視為行星了。科學家們已經決定我們的太陽系中只有八顆行星，而不是九顆。我想知道為什麼他們把冥王星排除在外。

cards.title: Plastic
cards.question: It’s amazing to think there wasn’t any plastic one hundred years ago. Now it’s everywhere. Almost everything that’s made has some plastic in it. Whoever invented it must be really rich. There are all kinds of plastic. It’s pretty useful stuff. I once went to an exhibition on plastic. I was shocked to see just how important it is in our lives. Look around you and count how many things you see or have or are wearing that are made of plastic. One day, we’ll need to find a replacement for plastic. That’s because oil will run out and plastic is made from oil. Maybe in the future there’ll be plastic museums full of valuable plastic. People will buy antique plastic. I think I’ll save some pens and plastic carrier bags. They might be worth something in the future.
cards.answer: 想想一百年前根本沒有塑膠，真是令人驚訝。現在塑膠無處不在。幾乎所有製造的東西都有一些塑膠成分。發明它的人一定非常富有。塑膠的種類繁多，實在是非常有用的東西。我曾經參加過一個關於塑膠的展覽，看到它在我們生活中的重要性讓我感到震驚。看看你周圍，數一數有多少東西是你看到的、擁有的或穿著的，都是由塑膠製成的。總有一天，我們需要找到塑膠的替代品。因為石油會耗盡，而塑膠是由石油製成的。也許在未來會有充滿珍貴塑膠的塑膠博物館，人們會購買古董塑膠。我想我會保存一些筆和塑膠購物袋，將來它們可能會值錢。

cards.title: Poetry
cards.question: Poetry is a very beautiful thing. I love reading it. It’s very clever. It’s like reading a painting. The poet paints beautiful scenes and images with just a few words. I think it’s amazing how the poet can change our feelings so simply, and can make us think with so few words. I like poems about nature and love best. When I read a poem about the countryside or the sea, I can actually see what the poet saw. When a poem is about love or other feelings, it makes me think more. I think people need to study and read poetry more. In some cultures, poetry is more popular than songs. I know that in many Arab countries, poets are superstars. One form of poetry that seems to be crossing cultures is Japanese haiku.
cards.answer: 詩是一件非常美麗的事物。我喜歡閱讀詩歌。它非常巧妙，就像在閱讀一幅畫。詩人用寥寥數語描繪出美麗的場景和意象。我覺得詩人能如此簡單地改變我們的情感，並用如此少的詞語讓我們思考，真是令人驚嘆。我最喜歡關於自然和愛情的詩。當我讀到描寫鄉村或海洋的詩時，我能真切地看到詩人所見的景象。當詩歌講述愛情或其他情感時，它讓我思考得更多。我認為人們需要更多地學習和閱讀詩歌。在某些文化中，詩歌比歌曲更受歡迎。我知道在許多阿拉伯國家，詩人是超級明星。一種似乎跨越文化的詩歌形式是日本的俳句。

cards.title: Police
cards.question: What would society be like without the police? They do a very valuable job. Without them, our society would be less safe. The police are the people we call when we are in danger or something bad has happened. Even people who say they don’t like the police will call them for help. I think being a police officer is an interesting but risky job. Police officers must see lots of strange things every day. I guess there is never a boring day in a police officer’s life. I wanted to be a police officer once but decided it would be too dangerous. I didn’t want to be in the middle of a riot or chase people with guns. I think we must respect the police because they do a difficult job. It seems as though their job is getting more difficult.
cards.answer: 如果沒有警察，社會會是什麼樣子？他們的工作非常重要。沒有他們，我們的社會會變得不那麼安全。警察是我們在面臨危險或發生不幸事件時所求助的人。即使是那些說自己不喜歡警察的人，在需要幫助時也會打電話給他們。我認為當警察是一份有趣但風險很高的工作。警察每天都必須面對許多奇怪的事情。我想，對於警察來說，生活中從來不會有無聊的一天。我曾經想過當一名警察，但後來決定這份工作太危險了。我不想身處於騷亂之中或是追趕持槍的人。我認為我們必須尊重警察，因為他們的工作非常艱難。看起來他們的工作越來越困難。

cards.title: Politics
cards.question: I often ask myself what politics is. When I turn on the television and see politicians in action, I think it looks like a circus. A lot of the politicians I see are like comedians. They lie, they steal money and get involved in all kinds of scandals. Politics should be about serving the people. This cannot happen when most of the people think most politicians can’t do their job properly. I’ve always found it strange that there are usually only two kinds of politics in most countries. You vote for the Democrats or Republicans, the left or the right. Some countries have a middle, but that’s still not a lot to vote for. I also think it’s strange that most politicians do not focus on what the people want. People want better health and education, not war.
cards.answer: 我常常問自己政治是什麼。當我打開電視看到政治人物在行動時，我覺得這就像一場馬戲團。我看到的許多政治人物就像喜劇演員。他們說謊、偷錢，還捲入各種醜聞。政治應該是為人民服務的。然而，當大多數人認為大多數政治人物無法妥善履行職責時，這是無法實現的。我一直覺得奇怪的是，在大多數國家通常只有兩種政治。你要麼投票給民主黨，要麼投票給共和黨，要麼是左派，要麼是右派。有些國家有中間派，但這仍然不算多的選擇。我還覺得奇怪的是，大多數政治人物並不專注於人民所需的東西。人們想要更好的健康和教育，而不是戰爭。

cards.title: Pollution
cards.question: I hate pollution. It makes me really angry. I think pollution is greed. People don’t care about the environment so they pollute the air just to make lots of money. Big companies are the worst. They pretend they’re not polluting. They have the money to say they are “green”. Pollution affects us all. We are all less healthy because of companies that pollute the air or our rivers. Everybody needs to think about how we can reduce the amount of pollution we create. Not using the car when we can walk is one way. Turning off lights we don’t need is another. Barack Obama says he’s going to do his best to help the Earth. I really hope he does because if pollution gets any worse, we’ll be in seriously big trouble.
cards.answer: 我討厭污染。這讓我非常生氣。我認為污染就是貪婪。人們不在乎環境，只為了賺取大量金錢而污染空氣。大公司是最糟糕的。它們假裝自己沒有污染。它們有錢可以宣稱自己是「綠色」的。污染影響著我們所有人。因為那些污染空氣或河流的公司，我們的健康都受到影響。每個人都需要思考如何減少我們所造成的污染量。不開車而選擇步行就是一種方法。關掉不需要的燈光是另一種方法。巴拉克·奧巴馬說他會竭盡所能來幫助地球。我真的希望他能做到，因為如果污染再惡化，我們將面臨嚴重的麻煩。

cards.title: Population
cards.question: The world’s population is getting bigger and bigger. There’s a population explosion in some countries. I’m not sure if this is good or bad. The Earth can only support a limited number of people. One day, the world’s population will be too big to feed everyone. When that happens, we’ll have food wars and water wars. Many years ago, the population was controlled by famines, a shorter lifespan, disease and other natural causes. We are richer now and so we can control how long we live. This is already causing problems in some countries. Japan, for example, has almost more retired people than working people. This means workers can’t make enough money to look after old people.
cards.answer: 世界人口不斷增長。在某些國家，人口爆炸的情況愈發嚴重。我不確定這是好是壞。地球只能支持有限數量的人口。總有一天，全球人口將會增至無法養活每一個人。屆時，我們將面臨糧食戰爭和水資源戰爭。許多年前，人口是由饑荒、較短的壽命、疾病和其他自然原因所控制的。如今我們更富裕，因此能夠控制我們的壽命。然而，這已經在某些國家造成了問題。例如，日本的退休人口幾乎超過了在職人口。這意味著工人無法賺取足夠的錢來照顧老年人。

cards.title: Pornography
cards.question: Pornography seems to be part of every culture in the world. The Internet has greatly increased the amount of pornography in the world. A lot of pornographic sites on the Internet are really bad. I think pornography is a very difficult issue. I wonder why people need to buy pornographic magazines and videos. I suppose it’s human nature. Or perhaps I should say its “man nature” because most pornography is for men. One thing I find interesting about pornography is how some countries say it leads to sexual crimes and others say it reduces them. In my country, there aren’t many laws to control pornography. It’s very easy to buy adult magazines and videos. But I don’t buy any… or rent any… or download any.
cards.answer: 色情似乎是世界上每一種文化的一部分。互聯網大大增加了世界上的色情內容。許多互聯網上的色情網站實在是糟糕透了。我認為色情是一個非常棘手的問題。我在想，為什麼人們需要購買色情雜誌和影片。我想這是人性使然。或者我應該說是「男性的本性」，因為大多數色情內容是為男性而設的。我對色情的一個有趣觀察是，有些國家認為它會導致性犯罪，而另一些國家則認為它能減少性犯罪。在我的國家，對於色情的管制法律並不多。購買成人雜誌和影片非常容易。但我不買……也不租……更不下載。

cards.title: Postal Service
cards.question: I wonder what will happen to the postal service. When I was young, I used the post office a lot. I went to the post office every week to buy stamps and send letters. I got excited every morning when the postman came. There was usually one letter for me – a real one. At Christmas and around my birthday I would get lots of cards. But today the post office is very different. I can’t remember the last time I went. I think the Internet is killing the post office. Most letters and mail sent today is via e-mail. I don’t even go to the post office to buy stamps. I get them from the local store. I’m not sure if the post office can survive, especially with competition from courier companies like Federal Express and DHL.
cards.answer: 我在想郵政服務會怎樣發展。當我年輕的時候，我經常使用郵局。每週我都會去郵局買郵票和寄信。每當郵差來的時候，我都會感到興奮。通常會有一封信是給我的——一封真正的信。在聖誕節和我生日的時候，我會收到很多卡片。但如今的郵局卻大不相同。我已經不記得上次去郵局是什麼時候了。我覺得互聯網正在摧毀郵局。現在大多數的信件和郵件都是通過電子郵件發送的。我甚至不去郵局買郵票，而是從當地商店購買。我不確定郵局是否能夠生存下去，特別是在聯邦快遞和DHL等快遞公司的競爭下。

cards.title: Potatoes
cards.question: Potatoes are very important in my life. Actually, they’re more important on my dinner plate. I love potatoes. They are amazing vegetables. I cannot count the number of different ways to cook a potato. Potatoes can be fried, baked, mashed, boiled, sauteed, and lots more. You can also eat potatoes hot or cold – I really like a chilled potato salad in the summer. Different countries cook potatoes in different ways too. Indian cooking is great if you like potatoes. My favourite Indian potato dish is called aloo gobi – that’s potatoes and cauliflower cooked in yummy spices. One day, I’ll have to find out how healthy potatoes are. I know fried potatoes are high in cholesterol, but I’m not sure about boiled potatoes.
cards.answer: 馬鈴薯在我的生活中非常重要。實際上，它們在我的晚餐盤上更是不可或缺。我喜愛馬鈴薯，這些蔬菜真是太神奇了。我無法計算出有多少種不同的方式來烹飪馬鈴薯。馬鈴薯可以炸、烤、搗、煮、炒，還有許多其他的做法。你也可以熱吃或冷吃馬鈴薯——我特別喜歡夏天的冷馬鈴薯沙拉。不同的國家對馬鈴薯的烹飪方式也各不相同。如果你喜歡馬鈴薯，印度料理非常棒。我最喜歡的印度馬鈴薯菜餚叫做 aloo gobi——那是用美味香料烹調的馬鈴薯和花椰菜。有一天，我得查查馬鈴薯的健康價值。我知道炸馬鈴薯的膽固醇很高，但我不太確定煮馬鈴薯的情況。

cards.title: Poverty
cards.question: I just don’t understand why we have poverty today. There is so much money in the world. We are rich enough to really make poverty history. My government talks about making a better society while there are thousands of people living on the streets. My government says it is making a more equal society. Rubbish. This is all words. Many people say religion is very important to them but do little to help poor people. In fact, many religious people I know don’t like poor people. And then there are multinational companies who give very little to the poor. They even take away their land and water. The people with the most power to reduce poverty are those doing the least. How can they live in such big houses and drive such fancy cars?
cards.answer: 我就是不明白為什麼今天還會有貧窮的存在。這個世界上有這麼多的錢。我們有足夠的財富來真正消除貧窮。我的政府談論要建立一個更美好的社會，而街頭卻有成千上萬的人在生活。我的政府聲稱正在創造一個更平等的社會。胡說八道。這些不過是空話。許多人說宗教對他們來說非常重要，但卻很少幫助窮人。事實上，我認識的許多宗教人士並不喜歡窮人。然後是那些跨國公司，對窮人的幫助微乎其微。他們甚至奪走了他們的土地和水源。那些最有能力減少貧窮的人，卻是做得最少的。難道他們能住在這麼大的房子裡，開這麼豪華的車子，這是怎麼回事呢？

cards.title: Power
cards.question: Power corrupts, and absolute power corrupts absolutely. This is an interesting saying. It’s very true. If you look at the world leaders with the most power, they are the most corrupt. When someone has so much power, they want more. Maybe power is like a disease. It eats into your brain and makes you want more. Once you have a lot of power, you forget about being a real human being. The usual story with people in power is taking lots of money from the country and forgetting about the people. It depends on the country, I suppose. The most powerful person in the world is the president of the USA. But in America, the president doesn’t actually have a lot of power. Every four years, Americans can vote a president out of power.
cards.answer: 權力使人腐敗，絕對的權力使人絕對腐敗。這是一句有趣的話，確實如此。如果你看看那些擁有最大權力的世界領袖，他們往往是最腐敗的。當一個人擁有如此多的權力時，他們會渴望更多。也許權力就像一種疾病，侵蝕著你的思想，讓你渴望更多。一旦你擁有了大量的權力，你便會忘記成為一個真正的人。掌權者的常見故事就是從國家中榨取大量金錢，卻忘記了人民。我想這還是取決於國家。世界上最有權力的人是美國總統，但在美國，總統實際上並沒有太多的權力。每四年，美國人可以選擇將總統罷免。

cards.title: Prayer
cards.question: Prayer is a very important part of many people’s lives. For those who pray, prayer provides great strength. But there are many people who do not pray. They either do not believe in God or are too lazy. I’m always impressed when people say prayers helped them through difficult times. Sometimes on the news, there is someone who was kidnapped. They tell reporters that praying helped them survive. This is the real power of prayer. Most prayers are more simple. People say prayers to thank God for the good things in their life. They might also ask for help or forgiveness. I’m kind of in between. I pray every day, but I don’t feel my prayers give me a lot of strength. I suppose they might if I hit hard times.
cards.answer: 祈禱是許多人生活中非常重要的一部分。對於那些祈禱的人來說，祈禱提供了巨大的力量。但也有許多人不祈禱。他們要麼不相信上帝，要麼太懶惰。我總是對那些說祈禱幫助他們度過困難時期的人感到印象深刻。有時在新聞中，會有被綁架的人出現。他們告訴記者，祈禱幫助他們生存下來。這就是祈禱的真正力量。大多數祈禱都比較簡單。人們祈禱感謝上帝賜予他們生活中的美好事物。他們也可能會請求幫助或寬恕。我有點介於兩者之間。我每天都祈禱，但我並不覺得我的祈禱給了我很多力量。我想如果我遇到困難的時候，它們可能會有幫助。

cards.title: Pregnancy
cards.question: Pregnancy is a time of great emotion, and a bit of pain and discomfort. For most people, the news that a woman is pregnant brings great joy. I remember being too happy to speak. I phoned everyone I knew. From that very minute, your life changes. You start thinking about names and whether it'll be a boy or a girl. Of course, you hope the pregnancy will be problem-free. The hospital visits are exciting. I loved looking at the ultrasound scans. It's amazing to see the tiny baby move and see its heart beat. The later stages of pregnancy are the most difficult. This is when the mother wants the baby to come so she can take the weight off her feet. I reckon pregnancy is similar all over the world.
cards.answer: 懷孕是一段充滿情感的時光，同時也伴隨著一些疼痛和不適。對於大多數人來說，得知一位女性懷孕的消息會帶來巨大的喜悅。我記得那時我高興得無法言語，打電話給我認識的每一個人。從那一刻起，你的生活就開始改變。你開始思考名字，以及寶寶是男孩還是女孩。當然，你希望懷孕的過程能夠順利無礙。去醫院檢查的時候令人興奮，我喜歡看超聲波檢查的影像。看到那個小寶寶在動，心臟在跳動，真是令人驚奇。懷孕的後期是最艱難的時候，這時母親希望寶寶能夠出生，好讓她能減輕腳上的負擔。我想，懷孕在世界各地都是相似的。

cards.title: Prejudice
cards.question: Prejudice is a terrible thing. It really damages our society. It hurts people and can cause great pain. It can even lead people to kill themselves. I’m not sure if prejudice is something that is getting worse or is declining. Were there greater prejudices one hundred years ago than there are today? I think prejudice should be on its way out. The world is getting smaller. We see different cultures more often. Then again, when I look at the news, it seems prejudice is getting worse. Even in my own society I see lots of prejudice. The prejudice is directed against people who are poorer, have a different accent, didn’t go to a good school, belong to the wrong sex. It’s crazy. We are all the same. It’s time we all understood this.
cards.answer: 偏見是一件可怕的事情。它真的會損害我們的社會。它傷害人們，並可能造成巨大的痛苦。甚至可能導致人們自殺。我不確定偏見是越來越嚴重還是正在減少。一百年前的偏見是否比今天更嚴重？我認為偏見應該正在消退。世界變得越來越小，我們更常接觸到不同的文化。然而，當我看新聞時，似乎偏見卻在加劇。即使在我自己的社會中，我也看到很多偏見。這些偏見針對的是那些更貧困、口音不同、沒有上過好學校或屬於錯誤性別的人。這真是瘋狂。我們都是一樣的。是時候讓我們都明白這一點了。

cards.title: Prices
cards.question: One topic that never goes away is prices. It’s not surprising really. Prices affect us all. The news recently has been about rising prices. But then I suppose that’s always been the news. Prices have been rising a lot though. Especially food. I reckon food prices have gone up 50 per cent in the last year alone. This is because of a rise in the price of oil and because of commodity prices. Everything has gone up. People also complain when some prices go down. When house prices decrease, homeowners get upset. I want to buy a house, so I’m quite happy when houses are cheaper. I would like to see hotel and airline prices come down. Then I can have a nice holiday.
cards.answer: 一個永遠不會消失的話題就是價格。這其實並不令人驚訝，因為價格影響著我們每一個人。最近的新聞一直在報導價格上漲的情況，但我想這一直都是新聞的焦點。不過，價格的確上漲得很厲害，尤其是食品。我估計僅在過去一年，食品價格就上漲了50%。這是因為油價上漲以及商品價格的影響。所有東西的價格都在上漲。人們在某些價格下跌時也會抱怨，當房價下降時，房主們會感到不滿。我想買房子，所以當房價便宜時我倒是很高興。我希望酒店和航空公司的價格也能下降，這樣我就可以享受一次愉快的假期。

cards.title: Pride
cards.question: Pride is a funny thing. Sometimes it’s good. People should take pride in things they do well. It’s also OK to be proud of the people you love. I’m very proud of my children for many reasons. My proudest moment was when my son was born. Sometimes I’m proud of myself. When I’ve done something really difficult, I’m proud of myself. I recently lost a lot of weight so I’m quite proud of that. Last week I told my students I was proud of them. I think teachers are proud of their classes. Of course, there are times when pride is not so good. Sometimes people refuse to say sorry. They know they are wrong, but their pride stops them from apologizing. If more people swallowed their pride, we could get along better.
cards.answer: 驕傲是一件有趣的事情。有時候它是好的。人們應該為自己做得好的事情感到驕傲。對於自己所愛的人感到驕傲也是可以的。我對我的孩子們感到非常驕傲，原因有很多。對我來說，最驕傲的時刻是我兒子出生的時候。有時我也為自己感到驕傲。當我完成了一些非常困難的事情時，我會為自己感到驕傲。最近我減了很多體重，所以我對此感到相當驕傲。上週我告訴我的學生我為他們感到驕傲。我認為老師們對自己的班級感到驕傲。當然，也有驕傲不那麼好的時候。有時人們拒絕道歉。他們知道自己錯了，但驕傲讓他們無法道歉。如果更多的人能夠放下驕傲，我們就能更好地相處。

cards.title: Privacy
cards.question: Privacy is something that is becoming more important to all of us. A long time ago, it wasn’t so important. Our world was small. We knew and trusted everyone around us. We rarely had to give people our private information. Today, with the Internet and modern communications, privacy is a hot topic. It is now possible to steal someone’s identity. There are even websites that sell people’s private details. We have to be really careful with what we put online. Especially on social network sites. The private info you put on these is there for the whole world to see. It’s easy to search for someone’s name in Google and find out all kinds of stuff. I think people need to think more about privacy and be more careful.
cards.answer: 隱私對我們每個人來說變得越來越重要。很久以前，這並不是那麼重要。我們的世界很小，周圍的人我們都認識並且信任。我們很少需要向他人提供私密信息。如今，隨著互聯網和現代通訊的發展，隱私成為了一個熱門話題。現在，竊取他人身份變得可能，甚至有網站專門販賣人們的私密資料。我們必須對自己在網上發布的內容格外小心，尤其是在社交網絡網站上。你在這些平台上分享的私密信息，對全世界都是可見的。在谷歌上搜索某人的名字，輕而易舉就能找到各種信息。我認為人們需要更加關注隱私問題，並且更加謹慎。

cards.title: Pronunciation
cards.question: Pronunciation is a funny thing. What pronunciation do you study? In England there are a hundred different accents but textbooks only teach one. What use is that? Actually, English teaching textbooks are pretty bad at teaching pronunciation. Look how many exercises there are – very few. And most of the exercises only teach one tiny point of pronunciation – word stress. And they don’t even show that the stress on a word changes in different sentences. I think pronunciation is very interesting. I wish all teachers used the phonemic symbols in every class. At least students could then improve their pronunciation with their dictionary. The most important thing about pronunciation is intonation, but few teachers teach this.
cards.answer: 發音是一件有趣的事情。你學習的是哪種發音？在英國有一百種不同的口音，但教科書卻只教一種。這有什麼用呢？其實，英語教學的教科書在教授發音方面做得相當糟糕。看看有多少練習題——非常少。而且大多數練習題只教一個微小的發音點——單詞重音。更糟的是，它們甚至沒有顯示出在不同句子中單詞的重音是如何變化的。我認為發音非常有趣。我希望所有的老師在每堂課中都能使用音標。至少這樣學生就能通過字典來改善他們的發音。發音中最重要的部分是語調，但很少有老師教授這一點。

cards.title: Property
cards.question: Property is one of the best investments you can make. Of course it depends on which country you live in. Buying property usually guarantees your investment will rise in value. If you have a lot of extra cash, you can play the world property market. Places like Dubai and other areas of the Gulf are good places to buy at the moment. I know lots of people who have made a lot of money from property. They have several houses and rent them out. The rent pays the mortgage and after twenty years the house is theirs. I’ve never had any property. I’m still saving up for the deposit to buy a house. I find the property market to be very confusing. I don’t like all the hidden costs involved in buying a property.
cards.answer: 房地產是你可以進行的最佳投資之一。當然，這取決於你所居住的國家。購買房地產通常能保證你的投資會增值。如果你有很多額外的現金，你可以參與全球房地產市場。目前，像杜拜和其他海灣地區都是不錯的購房地點。我認識許多人從房地產中賺了很多錢。他們擁有幾處房產並將其出租，租金支付了抵押貸款，二十年後房子就屬於他們。我從未擁有過任何房產，仍在儲蓄以支付購房的首付款。我覺得房地產市場非常混亂。我不喜歡購買房產時涉及的所有隱藏成本。

cards.title: Prostitution
cards.question: They call prostitution the world’s oldest profession. That’s interesting because in most countries around the world it is illegal. How can you call something illegal a profession? Should prostitution be illegal? If a man or woman wants to sell his or her body, why not? Every government knows it happens in their country. Even countries with the strictest rules have prostitution. Many governments just turn a blind eye to it. The problem with making it illegal is that female prostitutes suffer. They have no legal protection and so their job becomes very dangerous. In Holland, prostitution is legal. Prostitutes must have regular health checks and they can call the police if they get into trouble. This seems more sensible.
cards.answer: 他們稱賣淫為世界上最古老的職業。這很有趣，因為在世界上大多數國家，這是非法的。怎麼能把非法的東西稱為職業呢？賣淫應該是非法的嗎？如果一個男人或女人想要出售自己的身體，那又有什麼問題呢？每個政府都知道這在他們的國家發生。即使是規定最嚴格的國家也有賣淫的存在。許多政府只是對此視而不見。將其定為非法的問題在於，女性性工作者受到傷害。她們沒有法律保護，因此她們的工作變得非常危險。在荷蘭，賣淫是合法的。性工作者必須定期接受健康檢查，並且如果遇到麻煩可以報警。這似乎更為合理。

cards.title: Protests
cards.question: Protests seem to be everywhere today. Whenever I turn on TV there is a protest. Some are against governments, some are against companies, while others are in support of things. I think it's a good thing to demonstrate, as long as it's peaceful. Unfortunately, many governments hate protests and use a lot of force to stop them. Even "democratic" countries don't appear to like people protesting in the streets. Some innocent people who just wanted to change things for the better die. Images and news coverage of protests are everywhere nowadays because of the Internet. A few years ago, there would be no reports, photos or videos from some countries. Now we get a lot of news as it happens. That's people power.
cards.answer: 抗議活動似乎無處不在。每當我打開電視，就會看到抗議的畫面。有些是反對政府的，有些是反對公司的，而另一些則是支持某些事物。我認為示威是一件好事，只要它是和平的。不幸的是，許多政府厭惡抗議，並使用大量武力來鎮壓它們。即使是「民主」國家似乎也不喜歡人們在街頭抗議。一些只想讓事情變得更好的人因此喪生。如今，由於互聯網，抗議的影像和新聞報導隨處可見。幾年前，某些國家根本沒有報導、照片或視頻。現在，我們能夠即時獲得大量新聞。這就是人民的力量。

cards.title: Psychology
cards.question: I’d like to know more about psychology. I think it’s a very interesting subject to study. I’d like to know why I do the things I do. Looking at how the brain works and how we behave might make me understand people more. I’d particularly like to study child psychology. I love looking at children playing, thinking, drawing… doing anything really. But what makes them tick? What goes on in their little minds? Or perhaps I should say their big minds. If we all knew more about child psychology, perhaps we could do more to be a positive influence on children. Being a psychologist must be a very interesting job. Listening to people talk all day and then analyzing their behaviour. I wonder if they ever get bored.
cards.answer: 我想了解更多有關心理學的知識。我覺得這是一個非常有趣的學科。我想知道我為什麼會做我所做的事情。研究大腦的運作方式和我們的行為，或許能幫助我更好地理解他人。我特別想學習兒童心理學。我喜歡觀察孩子們玩耍、思考、畫畫……其實做任何事情都很好。但究竟是什麼驅動著他們呢？他們的小腦袋裡在想些什麼？或者我應該說他們的大腦？如果我們都能更多地了解兒童心理學，也許我們能更積極地影響孩子們。成為一名心理學家一定是一份非常有趣的工作。整天聆聽人們的談話，然後分析他們的行為。我想知道他們是否會感到厭倦。

cards.title: Public Relations
cards.question: Public relations is becoming a more and more important part of every company. The PR department in some companies is huge. People in PR have to work hard in getting the company’s name out there. I guess sometimes they have to lie. I’m not sure if a lot of PR staff actually believe the advertising of their company. Public relations is also now a huge part of government. The PR of presidents and prime ministers is carefully managed. A lot of taxpayers money is spent on making sure the leader always looks and sounds good. They must always say the right thing and have the perfect image. What a waste of money. When something goes wrong, it’s called a public relations disaster. That means most governments are public relations disasters.
cards.answer: 公共關係在每家公司中變得越來越重要。有些公司的公關部門規模龐大。公關人員必須努力讓公司的名字廣為人知。我想有時他們不得不說謊。我不確定許多公關人員是否真的相信他們公司的廣告。公共關係現在也是政府中一個重要的部分。總統和首相的公關工作都受到精心管理。大量納稅人的錢被用來確保領導者始終看起來和聽起來都很好。他們必須始終說出正確的話，並擁有完美的形象。真是浪費金錢。當事情出錯時，這被稱為公共關係災難。這意味著大多數政府都是公共關係的災難。

cards.title: Pubs Clubs Bars
cards.question: Where do you go for a good time? Most of the people I know go to a pub, club or bar. Sometimes all three in one night. When I was younger I used to go pubbing and clubbing. We would all meet in a pub and have a few drinks and then go off to a club to dance. When the club shut, we’d head off to a late-night bar. I love going to pubs. They are full of atmosphere. Lots of people chatting, laughing and having a good time. Thankfully, pubs are no-smoking places now, so you can come home without smelling like a cigarette. I also still like clubs, although I’m a bit old now. I love the loud music. It always makes me want to dance. I loved going clubbing in different countries. Different music and atmosphere.
cards.answer: 你通常去哪裡尋找樂趣呢？我認識的大多數人會去酒吧、俱樂部或酒館，有時候一個晚上會去三個地方。年輕時，我也常常去酒吧和俱樂部。我們會在酒吧聚會，喝幾杯，然後去俱樂部跳舞。當俱樂部關門後，我們會去一家深夜酒吧。我喜歡去酒吧，因為那裡充滿了氛圍。許多人在聊天、笑鬧，享受著美好的時光。幸運的是，現在的酒吧都是無煙場所，所以你回家時不會有煙味。我仍然喜歡俱樂部，儘管我現在有點年紀了。我喜歡那響亮的音樂，總是讓我想跳舞。我喜歡在不同國家去俱樂部，感受不同的音樂和氛圍。

cards.title: Pyramids
cards.question: The Pyramids in Cairo are my favourite buildings in the whole world. I knew all about them when I was very young. They have always fascinated me. They really are one of the world’s wonders. People still don’t know how they were built. I think they are probably the greatest architectural achievement ever. Even the tallest buildings today are easy to build. The Pyramids were almost impossible to build, but they did it. Two things fascinate me about The Pyramids – their beautiful shape and their mystery. I love looking at photos of The Pyramids. When I visited Egypt, their beauty blew me away. And the great thing was I also felt their mystery. The Pyramids are full of hidden secrets, history and mysteries.
cards.answer: 開羅的金字塔是我全世界最喜愛的建築。我在年幼時就已經對它們瞭若指掌。它們一直讓我著迷。它們確實是世界七大奇蹟之一。至今仍然沒有人知道它們是如何建造的。我認為它們可能是有史以來最偉大的建築成就。即使是今天最高的建築也相對容易建造，而金字塔幾乎是不可能建造的，但他們做到了。關於金字塔，有兩件事讓我著迷——它們美麗的形狀和神秘感。我喜歡看金字塔的照片。當我訪問埃及時，它們的美麗令我驚嘆不已。而更棒的是，我也感受到它們的神秘。金字塔充滿了隱藏的秘密、歷史和謎團。

cards.title: Qualifications
cards.question: Qualifications are so important these days. Many years ago, a university degree was enough. A B.A. or B.Sc. would guarantee you a good job. Not now. Not even a Master’s degree is enough these days. It seems everyone has a Master’s degree. Some of the jobs I want now require a Ph.D. It’s also not enough nowadays to be happy with the qualifications you have. You have to keep your qualifications up to date, re-qualify, get new qualifications. It seems life has become one long certificate chase. Especially so now that many people will have several careers in their life. I know someone who got a degree in physics, then became an accountant, didn’t like it and studied to be a lawyer. He’s now studying for his teaching license!
cards.answer: 如今，資格變得非常重要。許多年前，擁有一個大學學位就足夠了。一個文學士或理學士學位能保證你找到一份好工作。但現在可不行，甚至碩士學位也不再足夠。似乎每個人都有碩士學位。我現在想要的一些工作要求擁有博士學位。如今，對於擁有的資格感到滿足也不夠。你必須不斷更新你的資格，重新取得資格，獲得新的資格。生活似乎變成了一場漫長的證書追逐。尤其是現在，許多人在一生中會有幾個職業。我認識一個人，他獲得了物理學位，然後成為了一名會計師，但不喜歡這份工作，於是又去學習成為律師。現在他正在準備教師執照！

cards.title: Quality
cards.question: How important is quality to you? It’s very important to me. Unfortunately, a lot of the time it’s also very expensive. But not all of the time. It depends on what you buy. I can buy very good quality clothes very cheaply. They are often the same quality as brand names. It’s also easy to buy good quality food. I go to vegetable and fish markets to get good quality and cheap food. It’s much better than the stuff in supermarkets. It can also be cheaper. I’d love a good quality car, but this is where my budget runs out. It’s still possible to buy a top-of-the-range Japanese car which is the same quality as a much more expensive German one. I do spend a little extra to buy a top quality computer – an Apple.
cards.answer: 品質對你來說有多重要？對我來說非常重要。不幸的是，很多時候這也非常昂貴。但並不是所有時候都是這樣，這取決於你購買的東西。我可以以非常便宜的價格購買到質量非常好的衣服。它們的質量往往和品牌名相同。購買優質食物也很容易。我會去菜市場和魚市購買質量好且便宜的食物，這比超市裡的東西要好得多，價格也可能更便宜。我很想擁有一輛高品質的車，但這就是我的預算所及的地方。仍然可以購買到一輛高端的日本車，其質量與一輛更昂貴的德國車相同。我確實會多花一點錢購買一台高品質的電腦——一台蘋果電腦。

cards.title: Quality Of Life
cards.question: Quality of life is important to all of us. It’s something we all try to improve. I’m just wondering how easy it is to improve your quality of life. The biggest things that affect how happy you are are your job, house, holidays and friends. Of course there are others. It’s quite difficult to change these things. If you don’t like your job, it can be difficult to find a better one. My job really affects my quality of life. If it’s really stressful, my quality of life goes down. You also need somewhere nice to live. That can be difficult to change. It’s important to find a home that feels like home. Holidays can add a lot to your happiness, but we don’t have lots of those. And then there are friends. They really improve your quality of life.
cards.answer: 生活品質對我們每個人都很重要。這是我們都努力去改善的事情。我只是想知道，改善生活品質有多容易。影響你快樂的最大因素是你的工作、居所、假期和朋友。當然，還有其他因素。改變這些事情相當困難。如果你不喜歡你的工作，找到一份更好的工作可能會很艱難。我的工作真的影響了我的生活品質。如果工作壓力很大，我的生活品質就會下降。你還需要一個舒適的居住環境，這也不容易改變。找到一個讓你有家的感覺的地方是很重要的。假期可以大大提升你的快樂，但我們並沒有很多假期。然後是朋友，他們真的能改善你的生活品質。

cards.title: Quarreling
cards.question: Why do people quarrel so much? I hate quarreling. It’s such a waste of time, and it’s usually totally unnecessary. I know a few couples who quarrel non-stop. I really don’t know why they stay together. They quarrel and argue more often they speak to each other normally. Perhaps quarreling is their normal way of communicating. And the things they fight about is amazing, like whether Coke is better than Pepsi. They can get really angry about this. No. There are better things to do than quarrel and argue. I think you should reach an agreement with someone. If an argument looks like appearing, you should both walk away and come back in two minutes. I’m sure that would make a happier world.
cards.answer: 為什麼人們總是爭吵呢？我討厭爭吵。這真是浪費時間，而且通常完全沒有必要。我認識幾對夫妻，總是吵個不停。我真的不知道他們為什麼還要在一起。他們爭吵和辯論的頻率比正常交談還要高。也許爭吵是他們溝通的正常方式。他們爭論的事情真是令人驚訝，比如可樂是否比百事可樂好。他們對此可以非常生氣。不，還有比爭吵和辯論更重要的事情。我認為你應該和別人達成共識。如果爭論似乎要出現，你們應該都走開，兩分鐘後再回來。我相信這樣會讓世界變得更快樂。

cards.title: Questions
cards.question: So many questions. I have hundreds. I could probably spend hours writing down all the questions I have. I don’t think I have as many questions as my small children though. They question everything. It’s almost impossible to stop them sometimes. Everything is “Why?” You really have to think sometimes about how to answer. You’re in big trouble if you can’t answer. My biggest questions are about people. I want to know why people kill and how they can be so greedy. I’d love to know why most world leaders rarely keep their promises to their people. I think if you wander around town, your mind will be full of questions. “Why did that person throw that wrapper on the ground?” “Why can’t that driver wait just two seconds?”
cards.answer: 有那麼多問題。我有好幾百個。我可能可以花幾個小時把我所有的問題寫下來。不過，我想我問的問題沒有我小孩那麼多。他們對一切都充滿疑問。有時候幾乎不可能阻止他們。每件事都是「為什麼？」有時候你真的得好好思考該怎麼回答。如果你無法回答，那可就麻煩大了。我最大的問題是關於人性。我想知道為什麼人會殺人，為什麼他們會如此貪婪。我也很想知道為什麼大多數世界領袖很少對人民履行承諾。我覺得如果你在城裡閒逛，你的腦海中會充滿問題。「那個人為什麼把包裝紙扔在地上？」 「那個司機為什麼不能等兩秒鐘？」

cards.title: Quizzes
cards.question: I absolutely love quizzes. I always have. Even when I was little, I loved them. At school I always had my hand up to answer questions. I remember looking at quiz shows on TV and getting more questions right than the adults. I guess I had a pretty good general knowledge. I was amazed when the game Trivial Pursuit came out – there were cards with thousands and thousands of quiz questions on them. And these were real questions. I didn’t know half of them. They were tough. I still like quizzes. There are loads of them on the Internet. I can’t resist doing one when I see one. I usually do the news quiz on the BBC. Just ten questions about the week’s news. I think I’ll always like quizzes.
cards.answer: 我非常喜歡測驗。從小我就喜歡它們。在學校時，我總是舉手回答問題。我記得在電視上看測驗節目，答對的問題比大人還多。我想我的一般知識還不錯。當《無知追擊》這款遊戲推出時，我感到驚訝——裡面有成千上萬的測驗問題卡片。而這些都是實際的問題。我對其中一半都不知道，真的很難。我仍然喜歡測驗。網路上有很多這樣的測驗。每當我看到一個，就無法抗拒去做。我通常會參加BBC的新聞測驗，裡面只有十個關於本週新聞的問題。我想我會一直喜歡測驗。

cards.title: Quotations
cards.question: Some people I know are full of quotations. They have remembered hundreds of quotes from Shakespeare and famous poets and politicians. They use them in mid-conversation. I think that’s impressive. I don’t think I could tell you five quotations. I studied Shakespeare at school but I can’t remember a single quote. “To be, or not to be, that is the question.” Was that Shakespeare? I know there’s another famous quote from Romeo and Juliet about the name of a rose. Sometimes I see inspirational quotations on websites. I like these. They make you think. Some of them are really clever. Other places I see quotations are at the end of people’s e-mail. Some of these aren’t so clever.
cards.answer: 我認識的一些人充滿了名言佳句。他們記住了數百條莎士比亞以及著名詩人和政治家的名言。他們在談話中隨時引用。我覺得這很令人印象深刻。我想我可能連五條名言都說不出來。我在學校學過莎士比亞，但我一條名言都記不住。“生存還是毀滅，這是個問題。”那是莎士比亞嗎？我知道《羅密歐與茱麗葉》中還有一句關於玫瑰名字的著名名言。有時我在網站上看到一些激勵人心的名言。我喜歡這些，它們讓人深思。其中一些真的很巧妙。還有一些地方我看到名言是在人們的電子郵件結尾。有些名言就沒那麼聰明了。

cards.title: Racism
cards.question: Racism should be decreasing around the world, but it isn’t. I think it’s getting worse. It really is one of the worst things in the world. It’s totally illogical and disgusting. How can you hate someone because of the colour of their skin. I know many horrible people who have my skin colour and many beautiful people with different skin colours. I remember at school hearing racist words said to someone. I felt sorry for him. He was the only non-white person in the whole school. I never understood where the hate came from. Racism never leads to anything positive. Accepting people from other races, and religions and cultures, can only bring many positives to the world. I hope my grandchildren live in a less racist world.
cards.answer: 種族主義應該在全世界逐漸減少，但事實上並沒有。我認為情況反而變得更糟。這真的是世界上最糟糕的事情之一。這完全不合邏輯，令人作嘔。怎麼能因為皮膚顏色而仇恨一個人呢？我認識許多膚色和我一樣可怕的人，也認識許多膚色不同的美好的人。我記得在學校裡聽到有人對另一個人說種族歧視的話。我為他感到難過。他是全校唯一的非白人。我從未理解仇恨的來源。種族主義從來不會帶來任何正面的結果。接受來自不同種族、宗教和文化的人，只會為世界帶來許多積極的影響。我希望我的孫子孫女能生活在一個更少種族歧視的世界裡。

cards.title: Radio
cards.question: It’s amazing how radio is still with us. Everyone thought that television would kill radio. It didn’t. Then music videos and MTV came along. That didn’t really affect radio either. It seems radio is becoming more and more popular these days. You can tune in to almost any radio station in the world nowadays over the Internet. I’m a big fan of radio and can’t live without it. I love radio phone-in shows. It’s fascinating to hear callers call in and talk about the latest news. Even though I have a CD player in my car, more often than not I will listen to the radio. I like not having to choose what to listen to. It’s also useful to get traffic updates. One of my dreams as a kid was to be a DJ and play my favourite songs all day.
cards.answer: 無法不驚嘆廣播依然存在於我們的生活中。大家曾經認為電視會取代廣播，但事實並非如此。接著音樂錄影帶和MTV出現了，這也並沒有對廣播造成太大影響。如今，廣播似乎變得越來越受歡迎。現在透過互聯網，你幾乎可以收聽到世界上任何一個廣播電台。我是一個廣播的忠實粉絲，生活中無法缺少它。我喜歡廣播的電話連線節目，聽到來電者打進來談論最新消息，實在令人著迷。即使我的車裡有CD播放器，但我往往還是會選擇收聽廣播。我喜歡不必選擇要聽什麼，這樣也方便獲取交通更新。小時候我的夢想之一就是成為一名DJ，整天播放我最喜愛的歌曲。

cards.title: Radios
cards.question: Isn’t it amazing how the radio has survived? It’s been around for maybe a hundred years and is still going strong. I don’t think it’ll ever disappear. We all listen to the radio at some point in our week. Even with all our new technology, the radio is still an important way of getting music, news and information. I remember my first radio. Forty years ago now. It looks pretty much the same as today’s radios. I used to listen to soccer matches on Saturdays. I still do that. I also loved breakfast radio. I love my iPod but when I’m driving, I turn on the car radio. I like the mix of chat, jokes and songs, except I don’t always like the songs, the jokes or the chat. And some radio presenters are really annoying.
cards.answer: 收音機的存活真是令人驚訝！它已經存在了大約一百年，依然生機勃勃。我不認為它會消失。我們每個人在一周的某個時刻都會收聽收音機。即使有了所有的新科技，收音機仍然是獲取音樂、新聞和資訊的重要方式。我記得我第一台收音機，距今已經四十年了。它的樣子和今天的收音機幾乎一樣。我以前常在星期六收聽足球比賽，現在仍然這樣做。我也很喜歡早餐節目。我喜歡我的iPod，但在開車時，我會打開車載收音機。我喜歡聊天、笑話和歌曲的混合，儘管有時我不太喜歡那些歌曲、笑話或聊天內容。而且有些廣播主持人真的讓人厭煩。

cards.title: Rain
cards.question: “Rain, rain go away. Come back another day.” This is a nursery rhyme we used to sing in England when we were small. We wanted it to stop raining so we could play. There was nothing more depressing than looking at the rain outside the window when we really wanted to go to the park. People around the world have different opinions on rain. I went to Dubai once and it rained. People were dancing in the streets. They said that rain was so precious. They think it’s a special occasion when it rains so they like to feel it on their skin. That makes sense. I do the same when it snows. People in Alaska might think that’s strange. I wonder how global warming will affect rain. More in some countries, less in others.
cards.answer: 「雨，雨，快走開。改天再來。」這是一首我們小時候在英國常唱的童謠。我們希望雨能停下來，好讓我們可以出去玩。當我們真的想去公園時，望著窗外的雨，沒有什麼比這更讓人沮喪的了。世界各地的人對雨有著不同的看法。我曾經去過迪拜，當時下了雨。人們在街上跳舞，他們說雨是如此珍貴。他們認為下雨是一個特別的時刻，因此喜歡感受雨水落在肌膚上的感覺。這是有道理的。我在下雪時也會這樣做。阿拉斯加的人可能會覺得這很奇怪。我想知道全球變暖會如何影響降雨。一些國家會增多，另一些則會減少。

cards.title: Ramadan
cards.question: Ramadan is the most important season for all Muslims around the world. I was surprised to find out it lasted a whole month. I was also surprised when I found out that Ramadan is at a different time each year. It usually starts 11 days earlier than the previous celebration, so Ramadan slowly moves from Winter to Summer as the years go by. It starts in the ninth month of the Islamic calendar. This is when the Koran was revealed to the Prophet Muhammad. The Muslims I know love Ramadan. They have to fast between sunrise and sunset. They can’t even have water. Smokers can’t smoke. But then after sunset, they have a party with their family and eat a lot. They party every night for a month. This sounds great.
cards.answer: 齋月是全球所有穆斯林最重要的節日。我驚訝地發現它持續整整一個月。我也驚訝地得知齋月每年都在不同的時間開始。它通常比前一年的慶祝活動提前11天開始，因此隨著年份的推移，齋月會慢慢從冬季移動到夏季。齋月始於伊斯蘭曆的第九個月，這是可蘭經啟示給先知穆罕默德的時候。我認識的穆斯林都非常喜愛齋月。他們必須在日出和日落之間禁食，甚至連水都不能喝。吸煙者也不能抽煙。但在日落之後，他們會和家人一起慶祝，吃很多食物。他們每晚都會聚會一個月。這聽起來真棒。

cards.title: Rap Music
cards.question: Rap music has taken over the world. I think that’s amazing. I was really into all kinds of music when rap first started. I thought it was interesting but never liked it enough to buy any rap. Several decades later, it is a major music genre. The big music awards now have a category for rap. Nowadays, most youngsters are into rap. They love the music and the fashion. Rap is one of America’s biggest cultural exports. When I travel around the world, I see Chinese rappers, Arab rappers, Russian rappers. Everyone is rapping. There is even a famous museum in Washington D.C. that says rap is one of America’s most important inventions. It will probably be as important as jazz. I still don’t understand it. Perhaps I’m too old.
cards.answer: 饒舌音樂已經征服了全世界。我覺得這真是太棒了。當饒舌音樂剛開始興起時，我對各種音樂都非常感興趣。我覺得它很有趣，但從來沒有喜歡到足以購買任何饒舌音樂。幾十年後，它已經成為一個主要的音樂類型。現在的大型音樂獎項中都有饒舌的獎項。如今，大多數年輕人都喜歡饒舌音樂。他們熱愛這種音樂和時尚。饒舌是美國最大的文化輸出之一。當我環遊世界時，看到中國饒舌歌手、阿拉伯饒舌歌手、俄羅斯饒舌歌手。每個人都在饒舌。甚至在華盛頓特區還有一個著名的博物館，宣稱饒舌是美國最重要的發明之一。它可能會和爵士樂一樣重要。我仍然不太理解它。也許我是太老了。

cards.title: Reading
cards.question: Reading is one of the greatest pleasures in life. I would be lost if I didn’t have a good book to read. I can’t remember any time in my life when I wasn’t reading something. I guess you could call me a bookworm. I’ve always got my head buried in a book. I think reading is more than just a hobby. It’s a part of who we are. We learn many things about the world from books. We entertain ourselves with great novels from all over the world, and from the past. Even novels from hundreds of years ago are a great read. You notice how much reading is part of us when you sit on a train. Everyone has a book, magazine, or nowadays, a computer. Everyone seems lost in their own world. The world of reading is not a bad place to be lost in.
cards.answer: 閱讀是生活中最美好的樂趣之一。如果沒有一本好書，我會感到迷失。我無法想起生活中有哪個時刻我沒有在閱讀什麼。我想你可以稱我為書蟲。我總是把頭埋在書裡。我認為閱讀不僅僅是一種嗜好，它是我們身份的一部分。我們從書中學習到許多關於世界的知識。我們用來自世界各地和過去的優秀小說來娛樂自己。即使是幾百年前的小說，依然是很棒的讀物。當你坐在火車上時，你會注意到閱讀是我們生活中多麼重要的部分。每個人手裡都有一本書、一份雜誌，或者如今的電腦。每個人似乎都沉浸在自己的世界裡。閱讀的世界並不是一個壞地方，迷失在其中也不錯。

cards.title: Reading Activities
cards.question: Do you like doing reading activities in class? What are reading activities? Does your teacher explain that you are going to do a reading activity? Reading activities are important. They prepare you to read a text. There are many kinds of reading activities. These can include doing a vocabulary activity on difficult words, looking at pictures, doing a quiz. Anything that helps you understand a reading passage is useful. I’m a teacher. I often wonder whether students like these activities. I’d really like to know how much they help. Reading activities seem to take more time than the actual reading. Maybe if you read the reading three times, you’d understand it better, without doing reading activities.
cards.answer: 你喜歡在課堂上進行閱讀活動嗎？什麼是閱讀活動？你的老師有解釋你們將要進行閱讀活動嗎？閱讀活動是很重要的。它們幫助你為閱讀文本做好準備。閱讀活動有很多種類。這些可以包括針對困難單詞的詞彙活動、觀看圖片、做小測驗。任何有助於你理解閱讀段落的活動都是有用的。我是一名老師，我常常想知道學生是否喜歡這些活動。我真的很想知道這些活動對他們的幫助有多大。閱讀活動似乎比實際的閱讀花費更多時間。也許如果你閱讀三遍文本，你會更好地理解它，而不需要進行閱讀活動。

cards.title: Reality Tv
cards.question: I don’t get the point of reality TV. First of all, it isn’t real, so I don’t know why they call it reality TV. How can it be real when there are TV cameras everywhere? People don’t act in the same way when there are cameras around. I think it’s the very worst type of television show. It’s all about celebrity and me, me, me. The people who appear in reality TV shows have no talent. There is nothing you can learn from these shows. TV companies must be really short of ideas, or money. I can’t think of a bigger waste of time than looking at a group of people in a room together, and seeing how they get on or don’t get on. I’m amazed they are so popular. Perhaps I’m missing something. If you know what the attraction is, tell me.
cards.answer: 我不明白真人秀的意義。首先，它根本不是真實的，所以我不知道為什麼叫它真人秀。當四周都是攝影機時，怎麼可能是真實的呢？人們在有攝影機的情況下不會表現得一樣。我認為這是最糟糕的電視節目。這一切都圍繞著名人和我、我、我。出現在真人秀中的人毫無才華。從這些節目中你什麼也學不著。電視公司一定是缺乏創意，或者缺錢。我想不出比看一群人聚在一起，看看他們如何相處或不相處，更浪費時間的事情。我對它們的受歡迎程度感到驚訝。也許我錯過了什麼。如果你知道它的吸引力在哪裡，告訴我。

cards.title: Recycling
cards.question: When I was young, we never used the word recycling. It wasn’t important. People would think you were crazy for recycling things. Today, things are different. We now know we have a problem. We use too much stuff and throw everything away. Lots of the stuff we throw away is very useful. It can be used again, recycled. This is good for the environment because we use fewer natural resources. I love recycling. It makes me feel as though I’m helping the Earth. I even buy things like used furniture and clothes. This also recycles. Some of the countries I’ve lived in are experts at recycling. There are giant bottle banks at the end of the street and places to leave newspapers, clothes, batteries and metal.
cards.answer: 當我年輕的時候，我們從來不會使用「回收」這個詞。那時候這並不重要。人們會認為你瘋了，因為你在回收東西。如今，情況已經不同。我們現在知道我們面臨著一個問題。我們使用的東西太多，然後把所有東西都丟掉。我們丟掉的許多東西其實非常有用。這些東西可以再次使用，進行回收。這對環境有好處，因為我們使用的自然資源更少。我喜歡回收。這讓我感覺自己在幫助地球。我甚至會購買二手家具和衣物。這也是一種回收。我曾經居住過的一些國家在回收方面非常專業。街道的盡頭有巨大的瓶子回收箱，還有可以放置報紙、衣物、電池和金屬的地方。

cards.title: Red
cards.question: Red is my favourite colour. I don’t know why. I have loved the colour red since I was a small child. I even painted my bedroom walls red. My mother wasn’t too happy. Now I’m older I still love red. I always buy a red car. But I never buy red clothes. That’s a bit strange. Red is a very passionate colour. It’s the colour of love. Sometimes I read about the personality profile of people who like red. They are hot-tempered, full of passion and have a great love of life. That doesn’t really describe me. Although I often “see red”. When you see red, it means you get angry. I’m also often “in the red” in the bank. This means I’ve used a little more money than I have. So when I get my bank statement I see red and can see red.
cards.answer: 紅色是我最喜愛的顏色。我不知道為什麼。我從小時候起就喜歡紅色。我甚至把我的臥室牆壁漆成紅色。我的母親對此並不太高興。現在我長大了，依然愛著紅色。我總是買紅色的車子，但我從不買紅色的衣服。這有點奇怪。紅色是一種非常熱情的顏色，它是愛的顏色。有時我會閱讀關於喜歡紅色的人的性格特徵。他們脾氣火爆，充滿激情，對生活有著極大的熱愛。不過這並不完全符合我。雖然我經常會“看到紅色”。當你看到紅色時，意味著你生氣了。我在銀行裡也經常“入不敷出”。這意味著我花的錢超過了我的存款。所以當我收到銀行對帳單時，我看到紅色，心情也會變得激動。

cards.title: Refugees
cards.question: The problem of refugees is getting bigger and bigger. In fact, it is such a problem that there are now many different words for refugees. There are refugees, political refugees, displaced persons, internally displaced persons, migrants, and more. A long time ago, it was easy to know what a refugee was. Someone who had to escape their country because they were in danger. It was usually people escaping wars. There were many refugees during the Vietnam War. There are millions of Palestinian refugees following wars in the Middle East. Today’s refugees escape their country because of war or because their leader is crazy. There are also refugees because of natural disasters like famine or earthquakes.
cards.answer: 難民問題越來越嚴重。事實上，這個問題已經發展到有許多不同的詞彙來形容難民。包括難民、政治難民、流離失所者、國內流離失所者、移民等等。很久以前，難民的定義相對簡單。那是一群因為面臨危險而不得不逃離自己國家的人。通常是逃避戰爭的人。在越南戰爭期間，有許多難民。中東戰爭後，巴勒斯坦難民的人數也達到了數百萬。如今的難民因為戰爭或是因為他們的領導者瘋狂而逃離自己的國家。還有一些難民是因為自然災害，如饑荒或地震而產生的。

cards.title: Religion
cards.question: Religion is very important for most of the world’s people. Almost everyone believes in a religion. There are hundreds of different religions. The biggest ones are Buddhism, Christianity, Islam and Hinduism. There are other big ones, like Sikhism and Judaism. I think there are two kinds of religion. There are those that believe in God, and those that believe in different gods. Some religions worship animals or godlike figures that look like elephants. There’s one thing I don’t understand about religion. They all tell us to respect people and that the number one sin is to kill another person, but most wars in history have been fought because of religion. What do religious people say about that?
cards.answer: 宗教對於世界上大多數人來說非常重要。幾乎每個人都有信仰。世界上有數百種不同的宗教。最大的宗教包括佛教、基督教、伊斯蘭教和印度教。還有其他一些大的宗教，如錫克教和猶太教。我認為宗教可以分為兩類。一類是信仰上帝的宗教，另一類是信仰不同神明的宗教。有些宗教崇拜動物或看起來像大象的神祇。我對宗教有一件事無法理解。它們都告訴我們要尊重他人，並且殺人是最大的罪，但歷史上大多數戰爭都是因為宗教而爆發的。宗教信徒對此有什麼看法呢？

cards.title: Rent
cards.question: I hate paying rent. It’s such a waste of money. And it’s a lot of money. When I pay rent. I always feel like I’m throwing money away. My rent usually takes over half of my salary. Of course, landlords are very happy. They sit back and let the money come in. The rent they receive pays for their housing loan on their house. The thing that annoys me most is that the rent I pay is more than what I would pay if I had a housing loan. Sometimes I’ve paid rent for a really bad place. When something broke, the landlord didn’t fix it. When I said I wouldn’t pay the rent, he told me he’d throw me out. The worst thing about rent is rent increases. These are usually very unfair. That’s just the landlord being greedy.
cards.answer: 我討厭付房租。這真是浪費錢。而且還是一筆不小的金額。每當我付房租時，我總覺得自己在扔錢。我的房租通常佔了我薪水的一半以上。當然，房東們非常高興。他們坐享其成，讓錢源源不斷地進來。他們收到的租金正好用來支付他們的房貸。最讓我惱火的是，我所支付的租金比如果我有房貸時所需支付的還要高。有時我租的地方真的很糟糕，當有東西壞了，房東卻不修理。當我說我不想付房租時，他卻告訴我會把我趕出去。房租最糟糕的地方就是漲租，這通常非常不公平。這只是房東的貪婪。

cards.title: Research
cards.question: Research is a very important thing. Without research, we’d have no new products. Our food would be more dangerous to eat. And we’d never go to the moon. I’d like to see my government spend a lot more money on research. Especially on research into diseases. Scientists have been researching into AIDS and cancer for years and still have not found cures. Research into technology is also important. There seems to be loads of research into information and computer technology. It’s amazing how quickly technology is changing. We really need to spend more to research how global warming is affecting our planet. This could be the most important research scientists ever do. Research to save the planet.
cards.answer: 研究是一件非常重要的事情。沒有研究，我們就不會有新的產品。我們的食物會變得更加危險。而且我們永遠不會登上月球。我希望我的政府能在研究上花更多的錢，特別是針對疾病的研究。科學家們已經對艾滋病和癌症進行了多年的研究，但仍然沒有找到治療方法。對技術的研究同樣重要。看起來在資訊和計算機技術方面有大量的研究。科技變化的速度真是驚人。我們真的需要花更多的錢來研究全球暖化對我們星球的影響。這可能是科學家們所做的最重要的研究。為了拯救地球的研究。

cards.title: Restaurants
cards.question: I love restaurants. I never get tired of going to them. I go to restaurants a lot. Maybe three times a week. I have my favourite restaurants, which I go to regularly. The waiters know me and I usually get very good service. But I also like trying new restaurants. It’s exciting to see what’s on the menu and how the food will taste. Most of the time a visit to a new restaurant is a great experience. But sometimes, I wonder why my friend recommended a restaurant. I’ve been to a few restaurants where the food was so bad, so tasteless, I didn’t want to pay. My favourite restaurants are Indian. I can’t get enough of Indian food. I love the smells inside Indian restaurants. And of course the tastes.
cards.answer: 我喜歡餐廳。我從來不會厭倦去餐廳。我經常去餐廳，可能一週三次。我有一些最愛的餐廳，會定期光顧。服務生認識我，我通常能享受到非常好的服務。但我也喜歡嘗試新的餐廳。看到菜單上的選擇和食物的味道總是令人興奮。大多數時候，去一家新餐廳的經歷都很棒。但有時，我會想知道為什麼我的朋友會推薦某家餐廳。我去過幾家餐廳，食物糟糕透頂，毫無味道，讓我不想付錢。我最喜歡的餐廳是印度餐廳。我對印度食物愛不釋手。我喜歡印度餐廳裡的香氣，當然還有那美妙的味道。

cards.title: Retirement
cards.question: I can’t wait for retirement. I’m praying I can retire early. I like my job, but I like staying at home and doing my own thing more. Many people fear retirement. They worry about what they’ll do. I’m not worried at all. I know I can fill my days forever. Retirement is a time to do all the things you never had time to do because you were working. I have over 1,000 books on my reading list. I have hundreds of things to learn on the computer and lots of new hobbies. Early retirement for me would be 50. Most people retire at 60 or 65. I think 50 would be perfect. You’re still fit and healthy. You can still do lots of things. I wonder what it feels like to retire so young. To wake up every morning and never think about work.
cards.answer: 我迫不及待想要退休了。我在祈禱能夠提前退休。我喜歡我的工作，但我更喜歡待在家裡做自己的事情。許多人對退休感到恐懼，他們擔心自己該怎麼辦。但我一點也不擔心。我知道我可以永遠充實我的日子。退休是一段時間，可以做所有因為工作而沒有時間做的事情。我有超過一千本書在我的閱讀清單上。我還有數百件電腦上要學的東西和許多新的興趣。對我來說，提前退休的年齡是50歲。大多數人是在60或65歲退休。我覺得50歲會是完美的年齡。那時你仍然健壯而健康，還能做很多事情。我想知道年輕退休的感覺是什麼樣的。每天早上醒來，從不考慮工作。

cards.title: Rice
cards.question: Rice is a very important food around the world, and I love it. Rice is one thing I seem to be able to eat lots of. It doesn’t matter if there’s a mountain of rice on my plate, I can eat it all. Billions of people eat rice every day. Billions of people probably eat rice three times a day. I could eat rice three times a day, but I don’t. I’m not sure if I could eat rice for breakfast. That’s because I’m English. Lunch and dinner are different, I can eat lots of rice then. The good thing about rice is that if you go to an Indian, Chinese, Japanese, Thai or Mexican restaurant, there’s rice on the menu. And it all tastes so different. Indian Basmati rice with curry is awesome; Japanese rice in sushi is heaven; and Thai rice is unbeatable.
cards.answer: 米飯在世界各地都是一種非常重要的食物，我非常喜愛它。米飯是我似乎能夠吃很多的食物之一。無論我的盤子上有多少米飯，我都能吃完。每天有數十億人吃米飯，可能有數十億人一天吃三餐米飯。我可以一天三餐都吃米飯，但我並不這樣做。我不確定自己能否在早餐時吃米飯，因為我是一名英國人。午餐和晚餐則不同，那時我可以吃很多米飯。米飯的好處在於，無論你去印度、中國、日本、泰國或墨西哥餐廳，菜單上總會有米飯。而且每種米飯的味道都如此不同。印度的巴斯馬蒂米飯配咖哩真是太棒了；日本的壽司米飯簡直是人間天堂；而泰國米飯更是無可匹敵。

cards.title: Risk
cards.question: Risk is an interesting thing. It is a part of many of our decisions each day. We rarely think about risk, but all of us weigh up risks before we do something. Some risks are simple, but potentially deadly. Do I run across the road now or wait for the green signal? Is it OK to eat this old fish? Other risks are more obvious, like when we invest money. The person in the bank even tells you about the risks and makes a risk profile of you. One financial manager told me I was a cautious risk taker, and then I invested in high-risk products. We can also take risks with our family and friends. Do you risk telling your mother you just broke her precious vase, or do you keep it a secret? Yes, risk is everywhere. It’s a part of life.
cards.answer: 風險是一件有趣的事情。它是我們每天許多決策的一部分。我們很少會思考風險，但每個人在做事情之前都會衡量風險。有些風險很簡單，但潛在卻致命。我現在是衝過馬路，還是等綠燈？吃這條舊魚可以嗎？其他風險則更明顯，比如我們投資金錢時。銀行裡的人甚至會告訴你風險，並為你製作風險評估報告。一位財務經理告訴我我是個謹慎的風險承擔者，然後我就投資了高風險的產品。我們也可以在家庭和朋友之間承擔風險。你會冒險告訴母親你剛打破了她心愛的花瓶，還是選擇保密？是的，風險無處不在。它是生活的一部分。

cards.title: Road Rage
cards.question: I don’t understand road rage. It is a problem that is getting worse all over the world. People are turning into monsters when they get behind the wheel of a car. They think the road belongs to them. They think they don’t have to follow speed limits or consider other drivers. I wonder why this is. What is it about cars and driving that turns normal people into maniacs? Some people simply hoot and shake their fists. The funny thing is that they also do the same things to make other drivers angry. Serious road rage happens when someone gets out of their car and gets angry. They can punch the other diver and sometimes even kill them. Why would you want to kill someone because they overtook you? Crazy.
cards.answer: 我無法理解路怒症。這是一個在全球範圍內日益嚴重的問題。人們在駕駛汽車時變得像怪物一樣。他們認為道路是屬於他們的，認為自己不必遵守速限或考慮其他駕駛者。我不禁想知道這是為什麼。汽車和駕駛究竟有什麼特別之處，讓正常人變成瘋子？有些人只是按喇叭並揮舞拳頭。有趣的是，他們也會用同樣的方式來激怒其他駕駛者。真正的路怒症發生在某人下車並變得憤怒的時候。他們可能會打其他駕駛者，有時甚至會殺了對方。為什麼你會因為別人超車而想要殺死他們呢？真是瘋狂。

cards.title: Robots
cards.question: A long time ago, robots belonged to science fiction. Children loved looking at movies with robots. Today, robots are real, and they are helping us. In the future, we will all have robots. They will vacuum the floor, wash the dishes, perhaps even drive our cars. I even think one day we’ll have robot friends. In Japan today, robot engineers are making robots to help old people and to keep them company. It’s still early days. I’d say we are another 20 to 30 years away from robots being everywhere in our lives. What will happen to us when the world is full of robots? There’ll be no jobs. McDonalds will be full of smiling robots. Maybe one day we won’t be able to tell robots and humans apart. Maybe they’ll take over the world.
cards.answer: 很久以前，機器人屬於科幻小說的範疇。孩子們喜歡看有機器人的電影。如今，機器人已經成為現實，並且正在幫助我們。未來，我們每個人都會擁有機器人。它們會吸地、洗碗，甚至可能開我們的車。我甚至認為有一天我們會有機器人朋友。如今在日本，機器人工程師正在製造機器人來幫助老人，並陪伴他們。這仍然是早期階段。我認為我們距離機器人無處不在的生活還有20到30年的時間。當世界充滿機器人時，我們會怎樣呢？將不會有工作。麥當勞將充滿微笑的機器人。也許有一天我們無法分辨機器人和人類的區別。也許它們會接管這個世界。

cards.title: Rock And Roll
cards.question: Rock and roll is one of the biggest cultural phenomena of the past century. It totally changed society. It had a huge influence on our fashion and lifestyle. Before rock ‘n’ roll, life was slower. Children respected their parents and wore sensible clothes. When rock ‘n’ roll came along, it unlocked children’s craziness. Suddenly everyone wanted to dance and shake their hips. Adults were shocked. The new music made young people feel more independent. They started to rebel against their parents and society. And then came sex and drugs and more rock ‘n’ roll. Thank goodness rock ‘n’ roll came along. Life would be boring without it. I wonder what life would be like if it…. I guess we’d all be wearing sensible clothes.
cards.answer: 搖滾樂是過去一個世紀最大的文化現象之一。它徹底改變了社會，對我們的時尚和生活方式產生了巨大影響。在搖滾樂出現之前，生活節奏較慢。孩子們尊重父母，穿著得體的衣服。當搖滾樂來臨時，它釋放了孩子們的瘋狂。突然間，人人都想跳舞，搖擺臀部。成年人感到震驚。這種新音樂讓年輕人感受到更多的獨立性。他們開始反抗父母和社會。接著，性、毒品和更多的搖滾樂隨之而來。多虧了搖滾樂的出現，生活才不會變得無聊。我想知道如果沒有它，生活會是什麼樣子……我想我們都會穿著得體的衣服。

cards.title: Roses
cards.question: Roses are my favourite flower. They are the perfect flower – beautiful in every way. I love the shape of roses and their beautiful colours. Looking at them is like looking at a wonder of nature. The colours are so deep and pure. A white rose is the whitest white, a red rose is the reddest red. And the petals are amazing. They are so silky looking and so perfectly formed. The rest of the rose is also cool. The leaves make the flower look even more beautiful. They have a wonderful shape. The stem is also a part of what makes roses perfect. It is very strong so the rose will always stand tall and strong. All of these things are probably why so many people love roses. There really is no better flower to express love than a red rose.
cards.answer: 玫瑰是我最喜愛的花朵。它們是完美的花朵——在各個方面都美麗。我喜歡玫瑰的形狀和它們美麗的顏色。凝視它們就像是在欣賞大自然的奇蹟。顏色如此深邃而純淨。一朵白玫瑰是最純淨的白色，一朵紅玫瑰則是最鮮豔的紅色。而花瓣更是令人驚艷。它們看起來如此絲滑，形狀也完美無瑕。玫瑰的其他部分同樣迷人。葉子讓花朵看起來更加美麗，形狀也非常優雅。莖也是玫瑰完美的一部分。它非常堅韌，讓玫瑰始終挺立而強壯。這些特點或許就是為什麼如此多人喜愛玫瑰的原因。沒有比紅玫瑰更能表達愛意的花朵了。

cards.title: Royal Wedding
cards.question: I just can’t wait for the royal wedding. I’d say it’s the biggest one since William’s mother Princess Diana got married in 1981. I’m going to watch TV all day on April the 29th.
